channel.title: KEXP Presents Music That Matters
channel.itunes:author: KEXP
channel.description: Straight from the knowledgeable KEXP DJs to your ears, now you can listen to a wonderfully eclectic mix of full length songs. KEXP brings you the music that matters from some of its favorite artists from the Pacific Northwest and around the world. See what KEXP's all about at KEXP.ORG.
channel.itunes:subtitle: KEXP Presents Music That Matters

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 259 - Hot, Sick and Tired
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Jaunt along with Morning Show host John Richards on his latest musical exploration. Recorded in a booth that was about 100 degrees and on a day when he was wacked out with illness, this week's podcast is both international and electronic, tropical and twisted, and possibly bubonic to boot.
1. Big Spider's Back - Secret Chief 2. Austra - Spellwork 3. Gardens & Villa - Black Hills 4. Boris - Attention Please 5. City Center - Obvious 6. Dreissk - Beholden 7. California Wives - Tokyo 8. Chad Valley - Fast Challenges 9. Selebrities - Can't Make Up My Mind 10. Yacht - Dystopia 11. Death Set - Slap Slap Slap Pound Up Down Snap 12. Ceremony - Not Tonight 13. Cuckoo Chaos - Jesus Flag

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 258 - Big Gay Podcast 2011
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
June is National LGBT Pride Month, and DJ El Toro invites you to celebrate with the 3rd annual Big Gay Podcast. You want to talk about diversity? Here's 75 minutes of fresh sounds by queer performers, ranging from conscious Seattle hip-hop and wig-flippin' garage rock to 8-bit electronica and neoclassical chamber music.
1. Hercules & Love Affair - Painted Eyes 2. Jessica 6 - Prisoner of Love 3. MEN - Off Our Backs 4. Big Freedia - Almost Famous 5. Noddy - Grind! 6. THEESatisfaction - Pause 7. Psychic Friend - Once A Servant 8. Hunx and His Punx - Lovers Lane 9. Kid Congo and the Pink Monkey Birds - Goldin Browne 10. Torche - U.F.O. 11. Early Day Miners - Hold Me Down 12. John Grant - Jesus Hates Faggots 13. Light Asylum - Skull Fuct 14. Unicorn Kid - Dreamcatcher 15. Diamond Rings - You & Me 16. Owen Pallett - A Man with No Ankles 17. Holcombe Waller - Risk of Change 18. Baby Dee - Yapapipi 19. Stephin Merritt - Forever and a Day

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 257 - It's A Beautiful Thing
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description: These are beautiful things: Puppies, sunsets, life, and DJ Kevin Cole's latest podcast, which features new music from Woods, Vetiver, Joseph Arthur, and more! 1. Vetiver - Wonder Why 2. The Ladybug Transistor - Fallen and Falling 3. Woods - Any Other Day 4. The Devil Whale - Magic Numbers 5. The Loose Salute - It's A Beautiful Thing 6. Joseph Arthur - Gypsy Faded 7. Ikebe Shakedown - Kumani Walk 8. Ocote Soul Sounds - Pathways 9. Loga Ramin Torkian - Az Pardeh (Through The Veil) 10. No Surrender - Give It Up

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 256 - Trust In Your Spirit
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex is back with a hot batch of fresh, underground, cutting-edge beats for your listening pleasure! Whether it's next-level hip-hop, party-starting house jams, heart-tugging dubstep tunes, or cosmic synth-pop anthems, this expansive podcast is bound to get you moving and grooving. Turn up the volume, let the sounds flood your senses, find your inner rhythm, and trust in your spirit.
1. The Physics - These Moments 2. Valentin Stip - Anytime Will Do 3. Baths - Seaside Town 4. Africa Hitech - Light the Way 5. Shabazz Palaces - Swerve... The Reeping Of All That is Worthwhile (Noir Not Withstanding) 6. Samiyam - Escape 7. MED - This Is Your Life (f. Blu) 8. Young Montana? - Bad.day 9. Kid Smpl - Morning 10. Buck UK - Separate 11. Dauwd - Could It Be 12. Ear Pwr - Mountain Home 13. Ford & Lopatin - Joey Rogers 14. Purity Ring - Ungirthed 15. Toddla T - Take It Back (Dillon Francis Remix) 16. Wiley - Numbers In Action 17. Dubbel Dutch - Fem Pressure 18. Cosmic Revenge - Memories (Beat Connection Remix) 19. RL Grime - Die 4 Me

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 255 - All Music. No Filler.
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
In this latest podcast, John Richards plays all music with little interruption. Hear some of John’s recent favorites as heard on the Morning Show, including the latest from Washed Out, John Maus, up and comer EMA, and much more.
1. Washed Out - Eyes Be Closed 2. Echo Tongues - Aniborne 3. Dag för Dag - I Am the Assassin 4. John Maus - Believer 5. EMA - The Grey Ship 6. Motopony - Wait for Me 7. No Surrender - Silver Hall 8. Holy Ghost! - Do It Again 9. Love Inks - Blackeye 10. Ganglians - Jungle 11. Generationals - Ten-Twenty-Ten 12. Gold-Bears - Record Store

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 254 - Out Through The In Door
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
You won't know which door is which after checking out Kevin Cole's latest mix featuring new Ravenna Woods, Marissa Nadler, David Bazan, and Bill Callahan.
1. Ravenna Woods - Headless Men 2. Howe Gelb & A Band Of Gypsies - Uneven Light Of Day 3. David Kilgour & The Heavy Eights - Diamond Mine 4. Marissa Nadler - Baby, I Will Leave You In The Morning 5. Bill Callahan - Drover 6. David Bazan - People 7. Tokimonsta - Day Job 8. Kid Smpl - Morning (Archie Pelago Remix) 9. Sports - Prizefighter 10. Holy Ghost! - Hold On

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 253 - ¡Manos Arriba!
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
In celebration of KEXP's new Latin music show "El Sonido," DJ Chilly once again curates an all Latin mixtape podcast, featuring lots of dance tracks with some hip-hop, reggae, indie-folk, dream pop and classic cumbia mixed in for good measure.
1. Mexican Institute of Sound - Carnaval 2. Quantic & His Combo Barbaro - Un Canto A Mi Tierra (J-Boogie Remix) 3. Rosendo y Su Banda - Me Voy Pa'La Costa 4. DJ Afro - Rata 5. Mr. Pauer - Cumbión Del Sur 6. Los Rakas - Ta Lista 7. Tarik feat. DJ Krazy - La Guial De La Foto 8. Systema Solar - Sin Oficio 9. DJ Dus - K Le Pasa 10. Zuzuka Poderosa - Entra e Sai (Sonora Remix) 11. Petrona Martinez - Sepiterna (Thornato Remix) 12. Algodón Egipcio - El Dia Previo 13. Fernando Milagros - Av. Perú 14. Fidel - Emocionado 15. Uproot Andy - El Puchi Lockoff 16. Mexicans With Guns - Dame Lo 17. Bomba Estéreo - La Boquilla (Dixone Remix) 18. Atropolis - Asi Asi Asi (feat. Noelia Fernandez) 19. José Larralde - Quimey Neuquen (Chancha Via Circuito Remix)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 252 - Hands In The Sky
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
The happy songs on this latest podcast, presented by Cheryl Waters, range from dreamy to jaunty to driving, and they'll make you wanna tilt your face towards the sun, throw your hands in the sky and sing, and maybe dance a little too. Enjoy new songs from Handsome Furs, Black Lips, The Antlers and more.
1. Handsome Furs - What About Us 2. The Wilderness of Manitoba - Summer Fires 3. Chris Bathgate - Poor Eliza 4. Elliott Brood - Northern Air 5. The Donkeys - I Like The Way You Walk 6. The Wooden Birds - Two Matchsticks 7. Eef Barzelay - Shaker Star 8. Here We Go Magic - Hands in the Sky 9. The Antlers - Every Night My Teeth Are Falling Out 10. My Morning Jacket - Holding On To Black Metal 11. The Globes - A Stitch Couldn't Save The World 12. Black Lips - Modern Art 13. Bibio - Take Off Your Shirt 14. Orchestra Poly-Rhythmo - Von Vo Nono

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 251 - Wait for It
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
All good things come to those who wait. If good things mean talking. Welcome to your spring/summer podcast jam with no interruptions presented by the Morning Show's John Richards.
1. Blue Sky Black Death - Our Hearts Of Ruin 2. New Division - Bucharest 3. Rainbow Arabia - Without You (alternative version) 4. Apparat - Ash/Black Veil 5. Moby - Sevastopol 6. Milagres - Glowing Mouth 7. The One AM Radio - Sunlight 8. Pulseprogramming - First They Fire 9. Asobi Sexsu - Perfectly Crystal 10. MNDR - Cut Me Out 11. The Kills - DNA

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 250 - Guess I'm Strange
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex’s sonic odyssey to discover the freshest in electronic and hip-hop beats has led him from his own backyard of Seattle to exotic locations all over the world, including layovers in California, Toronto, the UK, and even Russia! From bombarding to blissful, his latest podcast will be right at home on your trusty pair of headphones, blasting in your car with the windows down, or causing a ruckus on the most adventurous of dancefloors. Here’s to beats and being strange.
1. Wagon Christ - Introfunktion 2. Don't Talk to the Cops! - Guess I'm Strange 3. Co. fee - Destroy & Rebuild 4. Fly Moon Royalty - Higher 5. Hard Mix - Memories 6. Okay Colour - Golden Child 7. Groundislava - New Flesh 8. Gold Panda - Marriage (Baths Remix) 9. The Good Sin x 10.4 Rog - All For You 10. Stateless - Miles To Go 11. d'Eon - Tongues 12. Koreless - 4AD 13. Pixelord - Kiwi Dream 14. Ill Cosby - Gold 15. Jacques Greene - Another Girl 16. Jed and Lucia - Helium 17. Matthewdavid - Like You Mean It 18. James Pants - Dreamboat 19. Sister Crayon - Here We Never Die 20. Shlohmo - Places 21. Blue Sky Black Death - Sleeping Children Are Still Flying

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 249 - Hey Ho, Let’s Go
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole keeps it short, sweet and rockin' with new music from The Cute Lepers, Beach Fossils, My Goodness and more!
1. Charles Leo Gebhardt IV - Teach My Heart 2. The Cute Lepers - Noisy Song 3. Beach Fossils - What A Pleasure 4. Craft Spells - Party Talk 5. Crystal Stilts - Shake the Shackles 6. Moon Duo - Mazes 7. My Goodness - Blackout Baby 8. The Kills - DNA 9. Yarn Owl - Seashell Wind Chime

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 248 - Behold a Marvel in the Darkness
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Great music can get you through so much. Good days, dark days and the roller-coaster of day in between. Thank you to all the hard-working musicians who brighten our days and get us through the tougher ones. Cheryl Waters presents a sampling of those wonderful artists and their music, including lots of local talent, as usual.
1. Thunderball - Enter the Brahmin 2. Charles Bradley - The World (Is Going Up in Flames) 3. Eef Barzelay - Shaker Star (Terri Tarantula cover) 4. Typhoon - Claws, Pt. 1 5. Deerhoof - Behold A Marvel In The Darkness 6. Yuni In Taxco - Neutral Currents 7. Air Waves - Knockout 8. Parts & Labor - Rest 9. Japandroids - Heavenward Grand Prix 10. The Megaphonic Thrift - Candy Sin 11. Capsula - A Night In The Ocean 12. Hello Echo - The Coming Days 13. Viva Voce - Analog Woodland Song

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 247 - This Is What Happens at the End of a Long Dark Seattle Fall and Winter
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
The moodiest of the moody is collected here in the latest podcast by Morning Show host John Richards. From classical to folk, from dark Twin Peaks inspired spooky to the local musicians who brave the dark elements recording songs, this one should be listened to before summer finally takes over.
1. Yuna - Someone Out of Town (Live on KEXP) 2. Joshua Morrison - September 3. Legendary Oaks - One Inch Plantation 4. Dirty Beaches - Lord Knows Best 5. Balmorhea - Bowspirit 6. Pale Sketcher - The Rainy Season 7. Austra - The Beat and the Pulse 8. Oberhofer - Away FRM U 9. Mazes - Most Days 10. Buffalo Tom - Guilty Girls 11. Yuck - Georgia 12. Soft Circle - First Time

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 246 - The Future
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Tim plays some of his favorite tunes of thus year with a heavy focus on our great Pacific Northwest scene and some awesome National stuff too. If this is a preview of what's to come in music in 2011, then it's gonna a be pretty amazing year!
1. Loch Lomond - Blue Lead Fences 2. The Curious Mystery - Cool Kids in Tha Valley 3. Toro Y Moi - Go With You 4. Starfucker - Astoria 5. La Serra - Hold 6. Webelos - If You Choose to Stay 7. Craft Spells - After The Moment 8. Nite Jewel - It Goes Through Your Head (DaM FunK's Club Dub) 9. Noddy - Clear As A Bell 10. Fergus & Geronimo - Where The Walls Are Made Of Grass 11. Witch Gardens - Lifeguard 12. Karl Blau - Celebrate By Singing 13. Dirty Beaches - Lord Knows Best 14. Sister Crayon - I'm Still the Same Person

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 245 - March Madness
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole slam dunks his current faves on yo' ass with new music from Low, Eleventh Dream Day, Middle Brother, Capsula and many others.
1. Acrylics - Molly's Vertigo 2. BOAT - Forever In Armitron 3. Middle Brother - Someday 4. Campfire OK - Hard Times 5. Brown Recluse - Impressions of a City Morning 6. Paris Suit Yourself - Sometimes 7. Rainbow Arabia - Sequenced 8. The Deer Tracks - Ram Ram 9. Low - Try to Sleep 10. Capsula - Hit 'n' Miss 11. Those Darlins - Be Your Bro 12. Eleventh Dream Day - Satellite 13. Julianna Barwick - The Magic Place

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 244 - We Have Everything
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Did springing ahead leave you feeling discombobulated? Find your footing with Cheryl Waters' latest podcast, featuring a grounding mix of atmospheric and rocking tunes from the likes of The Joy Formidable, The Lonely Forest, Okkervil River, The Mountain Goats, and Paper Cuts.
1. The Joy Formidable - Whirring 2. The Lonely Forest - Coyote 3. When Saints Go Machine - Fail Forever 4. Lord Huron - The Stranger 5. Kelli Schaefer - Ghost of the Beast 6. Wye Oak - Civilian 7. Papercuts - Do What You Will 8. The Mountain Goats - Birth of Serpents 9. The Dodos - Black Night 10. The Rural Alberta Advantage - Stamp 11. Okkervil River - Wake and Be Fine 12. AgesandAges - No Nostalgia 13. John Vanderslice - Convict Lake 14. Davila 666 - Obsesionao 15. Young Galaxy - We Have Everything 16. Frightened Rabbit - Be Less Rude (Live on KEXP)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 243 - Ramp Up
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John Richards presents an abbreviated version of the Morning Show that starts chill and ends with distortion and feedback, making it the perfect soundtrack to anything 53 minutes long.
1. Washed Out - Feel It All Over 2. Teeel - Dark Passenger 3. Com Truise - Sundriped 4. USF - Branss 5. Ancient Astronauts - Impossible 6. Tommy Guerrero - March of the Madness 7. Afro Soul-Tet - Soul Rockin' 8. The Raveonettes - Forget That You’re Young 9. Starfucker - Bury Us Alive 10. Grouplove - Colours 11. Polite Sleeper - West Side High 12. Ringo Deathstarr - So High 13. Soft Moon - Circles 14. Disappears - Halo 15. Modern Athletics - Wooden Shoe

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 242 - Excuses, Reasons and Drama
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Here's the latest in DJ Shani Thunder's ongoing quest to find ear-tickling musical delights to share. Enjoy an hour of primal beats, sexy post-punk, lo-fi Elvis, sludgy psych, Danish electro-pop, spooky vocals, ambient heartbreak, and whatever other noise-scapes you want! Well, that's not true, you can't actually change the podcast. But here's hoping you have fun."
1. Autre Ne Veut - Drama Cum Drama 2. Solar Bears - Dolls 3. Blank Dogs - Longlights 4. Banjo or Freakout - Go Ahead 5. Laurel Halo - Metal Confection 6. Cheveu - Charlie Sheen 7. When Saints Go Machine - Pick Up Your Tears and Run 8. Bonjay - Creepin 9. Bibio - Excuses 10. Chrisma - Black Silk Stocking 11. Palesketcher - Seventh Heaven 12. Chimes and Bells - Reasons 13. Dirty Beaches - True Blue 14. J.C. Satan - Your Place 15. Pure Horsehair - Fire Next Time 16. Hype Williams - Rescue Dawn

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 241 - The Loneliest Number
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
One is the loneliest number, which is why Kevin Cole included eleven of today's hottest jams in this rockin' edition of KEXP's MTM podcast. Featuring songs from Macklemore, Bright Eyes, Drive By Truckers, and the Sea and Cake.
1. Yuck - The Wall 2. Lifeguards - Paradise Is Not So Bad 3. The Dirtbombs - Cosmic Cars 4. Macklemore - My Oh My 5. Los Chicharrons - Kounandi 6. Toro Y Moi - New Beat 7. Bright Eyes - Shell Games 8. Drive-By Truckers - Everybody Needs Love 9. The Sea and Cake - Skies 10. Smith Westerns – Weekend 11. Wild Nothing - Golden Haze

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 240 - Till the Sunshine
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Cheryl Waters presents some sunny music to perk you up and hold you over till the sunshine comes, featuring new songs by The Twilight Singers, Wire, DeVotchKa, Joshua Morrison and more!
1. J. Tillman - Diamondback 2. Joshua Morrison - Kill Devil Hills 3. Sharon Van Etten - One Day 4. The Twilight Singers - On the Corner 5. DeVotchKa - 100 Other Lovers 6. Joseph Giant - Till The Sunshine 7. Hollerado - Fake Drugs 8. Fernando - World From the Inside 9. Here We Go Magic - Collector 10. Wire - Clay 11. The Very Best Ft. Mo Laudi - Angonde (Remix) 12. Disappears - Halo 13. No Age - Fever Dreaming 14. Lake - Roger Miller

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 239 - Space Is The Place
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Deep in the void between celestial bodies, DJ Sharlese takes you on a musical trip through outer space. Featuring Chromatics, Tobacco, Helladope and brand new Fresh Espresso, this mix of songs will blast you straight to planet KEXP.
1. The Apples in Stereo - Floating In Space 2. Suzanne Kraft - Femme Cosmic 3. Tobacco - Mexican Icecream 4. Nite Jewel - Artificial Intelligence 5. Helladope feat. THEESatisfaction, Mikey Nice and Jarv Dee - Cosmic Voyage 6. Dam-Funk - Galactic Fun 7. OC Notes - Space Train 8. Fresh Espresso - Green Windows 9. Silk Flowers - Flash of Light 10. Chromatics - Circled Sun

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 238 - The Starlight Collection
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Steve Wynn, Stereolab, and Brian Eno all contribute to this dazzling collection that’s sure to be a stunning
treat as DJ Kevin Cole elegantly mixes these flowing songs that will now forever beat as one.
1. Steve Wynn & The Miracle 3 - Resolution 2. Sails - I'm Only Bleeding 3. Ceremony - Stars Fall 4. Sleepover - Peace Buds 5. Stereolab - Silver Sands 6. Le Futur Pompiste - Communication 7. Eux Autres - You're Alight 8. Mermaids - Holiday 9. Made in Heights - All the Places 10. Kotchy - Getaway 11. Pretty Lights - Hot Likes Dimes 12. Brian Eno - 2 Forms Of Anger 13. Blank Dogs - Goes By

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 237 - Spring Released
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
We celebrate the impending end of Winter and the start of Spring. Okay, maybe we're getting ahead of ourselves, but the latest podcast presented by Morning Show host John Richards is a moody exotic preview of some of the best records coming out in 2011 with Chad Valley, The Cave Singers, Yellow Ostrich, Tapes 'N Tapes and more.
1. A Sunny Day in Glasgow - Drink Drank Drunk 2. Chad Valley - Up & Down 3. Steve Mason - Boys Outside (Keep Shelly in Athens Remix) 4. The New Division - Starfield 5. Voxhaul Broadcast - Leaving on the 5th 6. Tapes 'N Tapes - Badaboom 7. Pains of Being Pure at Heart - Heart in Your Heartbreak 8. Yellow Ostrich - Whale 9. Violens - The Dawn of Your Happiness Is Rising 10. The Cave Singers - Swim Club 11. The Lighthouse and the Whaler - Under Mountain, Under Ground 12. The Veils - Bloom

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 236 - Roadhouse Radio
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Greg Vandy presents the crème de le crème of today's prolific indie-roots scene. From faux country crooners to pickers of the new trad, this mix includes Greg's favorite rootsy people doing their best songs of the past few years. It's mostly talk free and sweet like molasses. Enjoy!
1. Phosphorescent - It's Hard To Be Humble (When You’re From Alabama) 2. These United States - Honor Among Thieves 3. Shawn David McMillen - No Time Left In This Place 4. Megafaun - Volunteers 5. Deep Dark Woods - They Won't Last Long 6. The Dutchess & The Duke - Living This Life 7. Roadside Graves - Jail 8. Mavis Staples - You're Not Alone 9. Justin Townes Earle - Working For The MTA 10. Cotton Jones - Blood Red Sentimental Blues 11. Sam Quinn - Mardi Gras 12. Frazey Ford - Firecracker 13. Michael Hurley - The Early Bird Gets The Worm 14. Black Twig Pickers - Dead Man's Piece 15. Frank Fairfield - To The Sweet Sunny South 16. Cahalen Morrison & Eli West - Lost Lovin' Gal 17. Jack Rose - Lick Mountain Ramble
item.itunes:subtitle:
Greg Vandy presents the crème de le crème of today's prolific indie-roots scene. From faux country crooners to pickers of the new trad, this mix includes Greg's favorite rootsy people doing their best songs of the past few years. It's mostly talk free and sweet like molasses. Enjoy!
1. Phosphorescent - It's Hard To Be Humble (When You’re From Alabama) 2. These United States - Honor Among Thieves 3. Shawn David McMillen - No Time Left In This Place 4. Megafaun - Volunteers 5. Deep Dark Woods - They Won't Last Long 6. The Dutchess & The Duke - Living This Life 7. Roadside Graves - Jail 8. Mavis Staples - You're Not Alone 9. Justin Townes Earle - Working For The MTA 10. item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 235 - Sleep Forever
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
This time of year, with such dark and cold days, who couldn't sleep Forever? But, who can sleep with all the great music coming out? Here’s another collection of songs Cheryl Waters is loving right now, including four amazing Northwest bands and a couple of Canadians for good measure. Enjoy.
1. The Radio Dept. - David 2. Sports - To Catch a Thief 3. John Grant - Marz 4. Dolorean - Thinskinned 5. The Tallest Man On Earth - Like The Wheel 6. Sun Airway - Oh, Naoko 7. Active Child - I'm In Your Church At Night 8. The Hundred In the Hands - Pigeon 9. PS I Love You - Facelove 10. The Greenhornes - Saying Goodbye 11. Solvents - We Were Guests Here 12. Crocodiles - Sleep Forever 13. Wesafari - Matchbox

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 234 - Que Viva
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
DJ Chilly curates KEXP’s first all Latin mixtape podcast. "Que Viva" features some of the best in Latin flavors from (mostly) 2010. You'll recognize some KEXP favorites and hopefully dig some of Chilly's new discoveries as well.
1. Sonora – Memoria 2. Rita Indiana – Los Poderes (Kingdom Remix) 3. Frikstailers – Cumbianchamuyo 4. ChocQuibTown – De Donde Vengo Yo 5. Ana Tijoux – 1977 6. Los Rakas – Abrazame (Uproot Andy Remix) 7. Chico Mann – Mentirosos 8. Joan Soriano - María Elena 9. Grupo Fantasma – Montañozo 10. Davila 666 – Callejón 11. Tremor – Espina 12. Toy Selectah – Half Colombian Half Mexican 13. Cuarto Poder – Solo Tu Tienes La Llave 14. Poirier feat. Boogat – Que Viva 15. Banana Clipz – Coupe Cumbia 16. Uproot Andy/Geko Jones – Manuelita Remix 17. Novalima – Libertà 18. Very Be Careful – La Alergia 19. Madera Limpia - Perro Que Ladra

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 231 - Los Ambient Pop Rocks
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Enjoy the latest and greatest in electronic and rock as played on The Morning Show. It's a smooth start, soft middle, and fizzy finish. From Houses to The Radio Dept. and Small Black to PUJOL. End of the year Ambient Pop Rocks from John Richards and the Morning Show to you.
1. Houses - Soak It Up 2. Lower Dens - I Get Nervous 3. Keep Shelly in Athens - Running Out of You 4. Woodsman - Insects 5. Selebrities - When I Look At You 6. Small Black - Photojournalist 7. The Radio Dept. - The New Improved Hypocrisy 8. El Ten Eleven - Falling 9. Los Augustines - Book of James 10. Wild Wild Geese - As the Crow Flies 11. Pujol - Black Rabbit

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 230 - Spanning Time with DJ Shannon
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Celebrate life and music with DJ Shannon as she shares her fave top albums of 2010, best demos and live at KEXP tracks. Make your Total Life Forever with new music from Foals, Tame Impala, Pond, Violens, Rewards and Kuroma. We're spanning time! Make the most of it.
1. Foals - This Orient 2. Mad Rad - The Machine 3. Yeasayer - O.N.E. (Live on KEXP) 4. Violens - Acid Reign 5. Kuroma - Running People 6. Rewards - I Used To 7. Tame Impala - Solitude Is Bliss 8. Pond - Annie Orangetree 9. Wolf People - One By One From Dorney Reach 10. Clinic - Evelyn (Live on KEXP) 11. Augustines - Book of James 12. Dog Is Dead - Young 13. Menomena - Five Little Rooms 14. Alessi's Ark - The Horse (Live on KEXP) 15. The Head and the Heart - Lost in My Mind 16. The Radio Dept. - The New Improved Hypocrisy (Live on KEXP) 17. Channa Masala - When It Comes Easy 18. Braids - Lemonade

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 229 - Kevin Cole, International Man of Daring
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Like a Buster Keaton of today or a Tom Cruise of tomorrow, Afternoon Show host Kevin Cole does his own stunts on this week's collection of musical daring do, with the ferocious Stag, the death defying High Dials, the ominous Octopus Project, and many more marvels of the modern age.
1. Stag - These Times 2. The High Dials - Teenage Love Made Me Insane 3. Cloud Nothings - Can't Stay Awake 4. Sufjan Stevens - Heirloom 5. Breathe Owl Breathe - Own Stunts 6. Phil Wilson - Three Days 7. Jonquil - Fighting Smiles 8. Eternal Summers - Pogo 9. Frankie Rose And The Outs - Don't Tred 10. The Intelligence - Sailor Itch 11. Best Coast - Crazy For You 12. The Corin Tucker Band - Doubt 13. The Octopus Project - Korakrit 14. Truckasauras - Show These People Who's Springsteen (Yes We Can) 15. Sub Swara - Speak My Language

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 227 - Troy's 5 Year Anniversary Podcast
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Celebrating 5 years on the air at KEXP, DJ Troy Nelson takes you through some his favorite artists of 2010. Says Troy, "It has been the best 5 years in my life. I am always thankful to be a part of this amazing station, and look forward to the next 5 years and beyond!" As the current year comes to a close, you may find it hard to come up with your own top 10 list of best albums of the year, but here are some of Troy's favorites, and, who knows, they may become some of your favorites too. Check out brand new music from Kentucky, New York, Minneapolis, Canada, Denver, San Francisco, and of course, Seattle, with artists including Wooden Wand, Small Black, Happy Birthday, The Fresh & Onlys, Blood Red Dancers, and more!
Track list:
1. The Fresh & Onlys - Until the End of Time 2. Small Black - Search Party 3. Happy Birthday - Girls FM 4. Butts - Wiggle Drip 5. Young Rival - Modern Life 6. Tax & Leisure Corp. - Monkey Chemicals 7. Blood Red Dancers - Banks of Blood 8. Mad Rad - The Machine 9. Head Like a Kite - Robot Makes Love With the Swingset, 1976 10. Pomegranates - Prouncer 11. Wooden Wand - Sleepwalking After Midnight 12. Hearts In Space - Different Colors 13. Gospel Gossip - Ponds 14. John Wesley Coleman - Come On Cops

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 226 - A Programming Ninja in Broad Daylight
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Meet Mel Trejo. For years, she has worked quietly and stealthily behind the scenes for the KEXP Programming department. Recently, Mel has been added to the DJ roster and more often than not, she can be heard spinning music on the KEXP airwaves from 2am-6am early Sunday mornings. In this Music That Matters podcast, Mel emerges from the shadows and nocturnal airwaves to share some of her recent favorites.
1. Two Fingers - Fools 2. Bear in Heaven - You Do You 3. Suuns - Sweet Nothing 4. Baths - Pop Song 5. James Pants - Clouds Over the Pacific 6. Tennis - Marathon 7. Toro Y Moi - Leave Everywhere 8. Blank Dogs - Northern Islands 9. Duck Sauce - Barbra Streisand 10. The Books - I Didn't Know That 11. Starfucker - Julius 12. Tamaryn - Love Fade 13. Summer Babes - Crack Habit 14. Four Tet - Love Cry

Recently, Mel has been added to the DJ roster and more often than not, she can be heard spinning music on the KEXP airwaves from 2am-6am early Sunday mornings. In this Music That Matters podcast, Mel emerges from the shadows and nocturnal airwaves to share some of her recent favorites.
1. Two Fingers - Fools 2. Bear in Heaven - You Do You 3. Suuns - Sweet Nothing 4. Baths - Pop Song 5. James Pants - Clouds Over the Pacific 6. Tennis - Marathon 7. Toro Y Moi - Leave Everywhere 8. Blank Dogs - Northern Islands 9. Duck Sauce - Barbra Streisand 10. The Books - I Didn't Know That 11. Starfucker - Julius 12. Tamaryn - Love Fade 13. Summer Babes - Crack Habit 14. Four Tet - Love Cry
item.kexp:podcastitle: A Programming Ninja in Broad Daylight

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 225 - Metal That Matters II
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Looking back on the first year of Seek & Destroy, KEXP's metal and hard rock specialty show, Hannah Levin, the program's producer and co-host, reviews tracks by artists she was most fond of in 2010 and the ones to watch in 2011. Most of it is new music by Seattle artists, but also includes older tracks from Portland's Red Fang and a live-in studio performance by Tennessee's Coliseum. Seek & Destroy airs every Saturday night/Sunday morning from midnight till 2 a.m.
1. Black Breath - Spin On The Cross 2. Coliseum - Blind In One Eye (Live on KEXP) 3. Red Fang - Good To Die 4. The Sword - Lawless Lands 5. AFCGT - Two-Legged Dog 6. The Anunnaki - Sarcofage 7. The Absolute Monarchs - Should Have Known 8. Narrows - Recurring 9. Mico de Noche - Dirty Unicorns 10. Smooth Sailing - Sunday Morning Margarita

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 223 - I Heart Washington State
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Coffee, the Puget Sound and Twilight aren't the only things that make you love Washington State, there's a bunch of music too! DJ Sharlese and Trent Moorman (of Head Like A Kite, Fresh Espresso, and Mad Rad) have put together nine songs about the state they love and added a bit of commentary to boot. They heart the Evergreen State and after you listen to this podcast, you will too.
1. Macklemore - The Town (from "Live at KEXP Volume Six") 2. Death Cab for Cutie - 405 3. Sleater Kinney - Dig Me Out 4. Boat - Prince of Tacoma 5. Mad Rad - Party Mountain 6. The Microphones - Anacortes Has a Secret Love 7. Blue Scholars - The Ave 8. Bishop Allen - Bellingham 9. The Lonely Forest - Live There

item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole brings you a mix of perfect power pop from Seattle, Argentinean electocumbia, South African freakbeats, and some rambunctious rock.

item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole and Online Content Coordinator Jim Beckmann present a diverse mix of artists performing the Iceland
Airwaves Festival this year, including two Seattle bands.

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:

item.description:
Morning Show host John Richards presents a free-flowing mix of electronic and acoustic songs from artists who for the most part were born in the decade they are influenced by.
1. Wildbirds & Peacedrums - Bleed Like There Was No Other Flood 2. Matthew Dear - Slowdance 3. Buddy Ross - Merry Man 4. Memory Tapes - Bicycle 5. Clubfeet - Edge of Extremes 6. Summer Camp - Round the Moon 7. Kisses - People Can Do the Most Amazing Things 8. Cass McCombs - Dreams Come True Girl 9. Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr. - Nothing But Our Love 10. Noddy - By Hook or By Crook

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 217 - Spotlight on Decibel Festival 2010
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex shines a spotlight on select artists performing at this year's 7th annual Decibel Festival, Seattle's premier electronic music and arts event! Running from September 22nd to September 26th, this year's Decibel Festival is the biggest and brightest yet, featuring 25+ diverse showcases, over 100 acts from all over the world, and an astounding number of live NW debuts! Tune in to get a taste of this year's diverse and stacked roster, and check out www.dbfestival.com for more information!
01. Mount Kimbie - Before I Move Off 02. Alex B - You and I Both Know 03. Gold Panda - Quitter's Raga 04. Flying Lotus - Computer Face/Pure Being 05. Oneohtrix Point Never - Zones Without People 06. Shlohmo - Glue Stick 07. Scuba - So You Think You're Special 08. Ill Cosby - Chrome Plated Laser Blasters 09. 214 - Tork Shuffle 10. Lorn - Glass and Silver 11. Carl Craig and Mortiz Von Oswald - Interlude 12. Starkey - Pleasure Points 13. Sepalcure - Every Day Of My Life 14. Splatinum - Want It 15. Ikonika - They Are Losing The War 16. FaltyDL - My Friends Will Always Say... 17. Mux Mool - Enceladus 18. Pezzner - Chapter_Two 19. Trus'me - Put It On Me 20. Lusine - Two Dots (Reverse Engineered) 21. Emancipator - Safe in the Steep Cliffs

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 216 - Das Super Popwelt
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole is your tour guide through an eclectic mix of music from candy-coated pop from Australia and Spain, to apocalyptic Americana from Seattle. It's das super popwelt!

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 215 - Bumbershoot 2010 Sneak Preview
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Cheryl Waters presents the annual sneak preview of the Bumbershoot Music and Arts Festival, happening on Labor Day weekend, and celebrating its 40th anniversary. Listen to a small sampling of this year's Bumbershoot lineup with a heavy emphasis on local artists. See you there.
1. Neko Case - People Got a Lotta Nerve 2. Hey Marseilles - From a Terrace 3. Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeroes - Home 4. Ra Ra Riot - Boy 5. Surfer Blood - Floating Vibes 6. Japandroids - Heart Sweats 7. Laura Veirs - Cast a Hook in Me 8. The Clientele - Harvest Time 9. The Raveonettes - Aly, Walk With Me 10. Grynch - Chemisty (f. One Be Lo) 11. The Thermals - Now We Can See 12. Visqueen - Ward 13. Cute Lepers - Smart Accessories 14. JEFF the Brotherhood - Heavy Days 15. The Maldives - Goodbye

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 214 - Genre Bending Mood Music
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
From classical to pop, dark synth pop to emotional acoustic in-studios from the Capitol Block Party to a NYC connection
3000 miles away, the latest podcast from John Richards brings it all together and somehow all songs on their own make up
the whole of the podcast.
1. Olafur Arnalds - Tunglia 2. Max Richter - Infra 5 3. Emanciapator - Greenland 4. Sea of Cortez - The Shores 5. Beat Connection - In the Water 6. Lonely Forest - Live There 7. Villagers - Home 8. Villagers - Home (Live on KEXP) 9. Chief - Night and Day 10. Neon Indian - Sleep Paralysist (Live on KEXP) 11. Fiveng - Give Me a Taste 12. Soft Moon - Breathe the Fire 13. Crash City Saints - Out from the Storm 14. Thieving Irons - Wave's Gonna Break 15. The Young Evils - A Just Built Beaming Light

Crash City Saints - Out from the Storm 14. Thieving Irons - Wave's Gonna Break 15. The Young Evils - A Just Built Beaming Light
item.itunes:summary:
From classical to pop, dark synth pop to emotional acoustic in-studios from the Capitol Block Party to a NYC connection
3000 miles away, the latest podcast from John Richards brings it all together and somehow all songs on their own make up
the whole of the podcast.
1. Olafur Arnalds - Tunglia 2. Max Richter - Infra 5 3. Emanciapator - Greenland 4. Sea of Cortez - The Shores 5. Beat Connection - In the Water 6. Lonely Forest - Live There 7. Villagers - Home 8. item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Join DJ Chilly for another installment of his hip-hop mixtape podcast series, featuring some of his favorites from the last year or so: national, international, and tons of Two-Oh Sickness.
1. Jern Eye – Get Down 2. Mash Hall – Hella Hella/Can You Stand The Reign 3. Dark Time Sunshine – All Aboard 4. Choklate – The Tea (WD4D's Spicy Chai Remix) 5. Jack Splash – Welcome To The Dance 6. The Physics – Coronas On Madrona 7. Los Rakas – Miel 8. Vitamin D – Let Go 9. Guilty Simpson – New Heights 10. Bean One – Pump Up The Volume 11. Murs and 9th Wonder – Cigarettes And Liquor 12. Freeway and Jake One – Never Gonna Change 13. Head Like A Kite – Director's Cut (w/Tilson) 14. El-P – Driving Down The Block (El-P Remix Redux) 15. State Of The Artist – Us (w/GMK) 16. BK-One with Benzilla – Mega (w/Haiku D'Etat) 17. Ana Tijoux – Partir De Cero 18. Eliot Lipp – Baby Tank 19. Shafiq Husayn – Lil Girl 20. Sonny Bonoho – Judge Brown 21. D. Black – Yesterday (w/Marissa) 22. J. Pinder – All That Fire 23. Shabazz Palaces – A Mess, The Booth… 24. THEESatisfaction – Do You Have The Time (Live @ KEXP from CHBP) 25. Alex B. – Hot Chop

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 212 - Kurt Vonnegut's Favorite Podcast
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Our latest podcast from DJ Kevin Cole captures a place, or a moment, where all the different kinds of truths fit together and where there are many different ways to be absolutely right.
1. The Thermals - I Don't Believe You 2. Wavves - King of the Beach 3. Wild Nothing - Summer Holiday 4. Capstan Shafts - Quiet Wars 5. Superchunk - Digging for Something 6. Ribbons - Total Loss 7. Coasting - Snoozefest 8. Faded Paper Figures - Small Talk 9. Dan Mangan - Road Regrets 10. Dan Sartain - Anything I Say 11. The Prids - Break 12. Western Roots - Rockers Galore 13. Cloud Cult - Unexplainable Stories 14. Zola Jesus - I Can't Stand

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 211 - No Water
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Cheryl Waters presents some really good songs for a good friend who is digging up the plumbing in his back yard. Good times. Enjoy.
1. The Books - Beautiful People 2. The Mynabirds - Numbers Don't Lie 3. The Radio Dept. - Heaven's On Fire 4. The Love Language - Heart To Tell 5. Earl Greyhound - Ghost and the Witness 6. Menomena - TAOS 7. !!! - AM/FM 8. Gabriel Mintz - Western Days 9. Plants and Animals - Tom Cruz 10. Ruby Suns - Cranberry 11. Archie Bronson Outfit - Shark's Tooth 12. Jaguar Love - I Started a Fire 13. The Goodnight Loving - Doesn't Shake Me 14. These United States - The Great Rivers 15. Black Mountain - Old Fangs 16. Balkan Beat Box - War Again

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 210 - Vibin'
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Street Sounds' Larry Mizell Jr. presents a set of hiphop ranging from the 206 to nashville, DC, pittsburgh and back again; the vibe is all about trying to block out the stress that life/family/government/yourself cause. Hopefully it'll help you do the same! Enjoy.
1. Yuk - Yuk the World 2. Starlito - Renaissance Gangsta 3. XO - I Got Doe 4. J.Pinder - Tougher feat. Luck One x Sax G Whiz x Spaceman 5. Sol - Not the One 6. JFK - Baby Mamma Drama 7. Eighty4 Fly - Free Fallin' feat. Grynch x J.Pinder 8. Xperience - Coco Jones 9. Yu - Close 10. Specs One - Vibin' 11. THEESatisfaction - Reagan 12. Husalah - You Never Know 13. Wiz Khalifa - Never Been
bed music by Victor Shade; instrumentals courtesy MTK

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
The latest Music That Matters podcast from John Richards is your soundtrack to a warm evening swim and or drinking late in the warm air with new songs from Unkle, Steve Mason, Damien Jurado, Gauntlet Hair and more!

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 208 - SMMRJMZ
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex is back with a new summertime mix to keep you cool during this sweltering heat! Packed with future beats, breezy chillwave, smooth hip-hop, kinetic electro-pop, seductive dubstep, and infectious house rhythms, SMMRJMZ brings the sonic heat to keep you feeling fresh during these sweaty summer days.
1. Keep Shelly In Athens - Cremona Memories 2. Shlohmo - Tomato Smash 3. Matthew Dear - I Can't Feel 4. Noddy - By Hook Or By Crook 5. Gold Panda - You 6. Baths - Plea 7. Andreya Triana - A Town Called Obsolete (Mount Kimbie Remix) 8. State of the Artist - Peyote Kids (f. THEESatisfaction) 9. Onra - The One (f. T3 of Slum Village) 10. The Samps - Peppergood 11. James Pants - 1988 12. Motor City Drum Ensemble - Raw Cuts #2 13. Dyme Def - Timeless 14. Moresounds - Day n Days 15. Regina - Saanko jaada yoksi? (Ghosts On Tape Remix) 16. PotatoFinger - The Annedoti 17. Policy - Speed of Life 18. Elite Gymnastics - Is This On Me? 19. Late - Bittersweet

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 207 - Who Stole the Electric Car?
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
A self-centered average guy steals a prototype electric car in a crazy attempt to win back his environmentalist girlfriend. His road trip playlist? New music from Janelle Monae, Pernice Brothers, Orgone, and Math and Physics Club. DJ Kevin Cole is behind the wheel on this eco-friendly summer podcast!
1. Janelle Monae - Tightrope 2. Beach Fossils - Vacation 3. Unnatural Helpers - Vox Humana 4. Pernice Brothers - Jacquline Susann 5. State of the Artist - Hey Hey 6. Orgone - Lookout 7. Fol Chen - In Ruins 8. Solex Vs. Cristina Martinez + Jon Spencer - Galaxy Man 9. Explone - Michigan 10. Good Luck Dark Star - Map of the Sun 11. Neverever - Teardrop Tattoo 12. Math and Physics Club - Love or Loneliness 13. The Beauties - Hearts Are Down 14. The Head And The Heart - Sounds Like Hallelujah

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Summer is finally here and, in honor of that giant glowing orb in the sky, Cheryl Waters presents a new crop of songs that is guaranteed to put a sunny smile on yer face.
1. Junip - Rope and Summit 2. Tame Impala - Solitude Is Bliss 3. Shake Some Action - How Does It Feel? 4. Yuni in Taxco - King of Borneo 5. Blind Pilot - One Red Thread (LIVE on KEXP) 6. Pearly Gate Music - Big Escape 7. The Poison Control Center - Being Gone 8. Let's Wrestle - We Are The Men 9. Phosphorescent - The Mermaid Parade 10. Blitzen Trapper - Heaven and Earth 11. Unbunny - Winning Streak 12. Ravenna Woods - In the World 13. The Oh Sees - I Was Denied 14. Wolf Parade - What Did My Lover Say? (It Always Had To Go This Way) 15. Dr. Dog - Shadow People

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 205 - The Big Gay Podcast 2010
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
As Jimmy Somerville once sang, "there's more to love than boy meets girl"-- and there's more to the queer musical universe than the usual suspects. June is Gay Pride Month and to celebrate DJ El Toro returns with the latest edition of the Big Gay Podcast, featuring nineteen varied selections from an assortment of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender musicians -- plus a couple topical tunes from the folks who love them. Viva diversity!
1. Goldfrapp - Alive 2. Shunda K feat. Cindy Wonderful - Here I Am To Save the World 3. The Redwood Plan - How the Game Is Played 4. The Soft Pack - Down on Loving 5. Owen Pallett - Lewis Takes Action 6. The Shondes - My Dear One 7. Parenthetical Girls - Evelyn McHale 8. Ozomatli - Gay Vatos in Love (Live on KEXP) 9. Ships - Up and Down 10. Logan Lynn - Feed Me to the Wolves 11. Hidden Cameras - Underage (Holy Fuck remix) 12. Mary Gauthier - Sideshow 13. The Endtables - Process of Elimination (unedited version) 14. John Grant with Midlake - Sigourney Weaver 15. Baby Dee - Lilacs 16. Stephenhero - I Will Sleep 17. Matmos and So Percussion - Treasure 18. Andy Bell feat. Perry Farrell - Honey If You Love Him 19. Morel - Shoegazer Disco (Linus Loves mix)

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
It's 2010 and you're super up on your knowledge of dungeons, but what about dragons? In this Music that Matters Podcast, DJ Sharlese takes you on an epic listening journey of dragon knowledge complete with a victorious track listing! Bring your sword, knight outfit, and blow-up castle to jump on 'cause you’re going on an adventure!
1. Karl Blau - Before Telling Dragons 2. Blitzen Trapper - Dragon's Song 3. Clues - Remembered Severed Head 4. 764-Hero - Dragon 5. Sunset Rubdown - Dragon's Lair 6. Blackalicious - Cliff Hanger 7. Of Montreal - Faberge Falls for Shuggie 8. James Pants - Dragonslayer 9. The Keeper - Sharpen The Axes 10. Partman Parthorse - At The Mall 11. Black Daisy - The Dragon 12. Onry Ozzborn - It's True (featuring Cape Cowen of Dark Time Sunshine, Awol One produced by Ecid)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 202 - Flash Forward Now!
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Discover your place in the world with this musical walkabout presented by Kevin Cole, featuring Scottish pop from Teenage Fanclub, Chilean rap from Ana Tijoux, Australian anxiety rocker from Eddy Current Suppression Ring, new old school funk from Brooklynites Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings, plus much more!
1. The Secret History - My Life with the Living Dead (The World That Never Was, Le Grand Magistery) 2. The Lodger - Have A Little Faith In People (Flashbacks, Slumberland) 3. Club 8 - Western Hospitality (The People's Record, Labrador) 4. The Redwood Plan - How The Game Is Played (Racing Towards the Heartbreak, Fish the Cat) 5. Male Bonding - Year's Not Long (Nothing Hurts, Sub Pop) 6. Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings - (I Learned the Hard Way, Daptone) 7. Ana Tijoux - 1977 (1977, Nacional) 8. Head Like A Kite - Let's Start It All Again (featuring Asya Smoosh) (Dreams Suspend Night, self-released) 9. Woods - Blood Dries Darker (At Echo Lake, Woodsist) 10. Teenage Fanclub - Baby Lee (Shadows, Merge) 11. Lali Puna - Remember (Our Inventions, Morr) 12. Annuals - Sweet Sister (Sweet Sister, Lefse Records) 13. Eddy Current Suppression Ring - Second Guessing (Rush to Relax, Goner) 14. Wooden Shjips - Loose Lips (Vol. 2, Sick Thirst Records) 15. Disappears - Magics (Lux, Kranky)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 201 - DJ Michele Myers' Dance Party
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
High-energy DJ Michele Myers brings you non-stop dance trax so turn down the lights, roll back the rugs and get ready to sweat!
1. Justice - Genesis 2. Amanda Blank - DJ 3. Moby - I Love To Move In Here 4. Gnarls Barkley - Crazy 5. My Robot Friend - Waiting (feat. Alison Moyet) 6. Santigold - L.E.S. Artistes 7. Gift of Gab - Dreamin 8. Major Lazer - Can't Stop Now (feat. Jovi Rockwell and Mr. Vegas) 9. Galactic - Heart of Steel (feat. Irma Thomas) 10. Alice Russell - Hurry On Now (Emika Remix) 11. Crystal Castles - Crimewave 12. Girl Talk - Summer Smoke 13. Thunderheist - The Party After

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 199 - John Richards' Untitled Podcast No. 553
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Music That Matters, Vol. 199 - John Richards' Untitled Podcast No. 553
The latest podcast from John Richards arrives just in time for these happy spring days. Motivating and emotional, this
podcast is chock full of new, insanely catchy songs that John is currently excited about and featuring on the Morning
Show.
1. Neon Indian - Sleep Paralasyst (single, Green Label Sound) 2. The Ruby Suns - Closet Astrologer (Fight Softly, Sub Pop) 3. Dark Time Sunshine - Run (Believeyoume, Fake Four Inc.) 4. Voyager One - 1,000 Miles, 1,000 Deaths (Geography EP, self-released) 5. Fang Island - Life Coach (Fang Island, Sargent House) 6. The Absolute Monarchs -Sharp (Absolute Monarchs EP, self-released) 7. Double Dagger - Imitation is the Most Boring Form of Flattery (Masks EP, Thrill Jockey) 8. The Secret History - Johnny Anorok (The World That Never Was, Le Grand Magistery) 9. The Lights - Puerto Escondido (Failed Graves, Wantage USA) 10. The Tallest Man on Earth - Burden of Tomorrow (The Wild Hunt, Dead Oceans) 11. Seabear - Fire Dies Down (We Built a Fire, Morr Music) 12. Sambassadeur - Days (European, Labrador)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 198 - Watching As She Reels
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Shani is back with her latest podcast. Enjoy 19 of her new favorite songs spanning lo-fi, garage, minimal wave/synth, post-punk, psychedelic, electronic, pop, ambient, and noise!
1. Rafael Anton Irisarri - Watching As She Reels- Hopes and Dreams 7"- (Immune) 2. The Method Actors - She (This Is Still It, Acute) 3. Wet Dog - Lower Leg (Frauhaus, Angular) 4. Wounded Lion - Degobah System (Wounded Lion, In The Red) 5. Amen Dunes - No Shot (Dia, Locust) 6. Here We Go Magic - Collector (Pigeons, Secretly Canadian) 7. M Bryo - Show Me Your Hands (V/A: From Minimal Wave With Love, Minimal Wave) 8. Growing - Short Circuit (Pumps, Vice) 9. Caribou - Jamelia (Swim, Merge) 10. Secret Cities - Pink Graffiti (Pink Graffiti, Western Vinyl) 11. Gary Wilson - Electric Endicott (Electric Endicott, self-released) 12. Sonny and the Sunsets - Planet of Women (Tomorrow Is Alright, Soft Abuse) 13. Él-G - Tim et Henri (Tout Ploie, S-S) 14. Grouper - Hold the Way (Grouper/Roy Montgomery Split 12", Yellow Electric/Root Strata) 15. Under Byen - Konstant (Alt Er Tabt, Paper Bag) 16. Wolf People - Interlude: Circle/Viking/Colours (Tidings, Jagjaguwar) 17. Inlets - In Which I, Robert (Inter Arbiter, twosyllable) 18. Zola Jesus - The Night (Stridilum EP, Sacred Bones) 19. Wehrwolve - Caveden (Interstellar Spaceports Lost)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 197 - 14 Songs To Self-Esteem
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
When the ME guys begin to bully the girls, DJ Kevin Cole turns to the music of Black Tambourine, The Hold Steady, and Citizen Cope to give the girls an ego boost and teach the boys respect.
1. Black Tambourine - We Can't Be Friends (Complete Recordings, Slumberland) 2. The Electric Pop Group - Out Of Sight (Seconds, Matinee Records) 3. World Atlas - The Winter Stories (World Atlas EP, Magic Marker) 4. The Hold Steady - Hurricane J (Heaven Is Whenever, Vagrant Records) 5. Overnight Lows - So Well Read (City Of Rotten Eyes, Goner Records) 6. Dinosaur Feathers - I Ni Sogoma, (Fantasy Memorial, self-released) 7. Tunng, Hustle (...And Then We Saw Land, Thrill Jockey) 8. Future Islands - Tin Man (In The Evening Air, Thrill Jockey) 9. Javelin - Vibrationz (No Mas, Luaka Bop) 10. Nortec Collective Presents: Clorofila - Discoteca Nacional (Corridos Urbanos, Nacional Records) 11. Kings Go Forth - I Don't Love You No More (The Outsiders Are Back, Luaka Bop) 12. Citizen Cope - Off the Ground (The Rainwater LP, Rainwater Records) 13. Georgia Anne Muldrow - Simple Advice (Kings Ballad, Ubiquity) 14. The Natural Yogurt Band - Space Echo (Away With Melancholy, Now-Again Records)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 196 - Sunny Days Ahead
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Sunny days are ahead both in the sky and on the airwaves, and Cheryl Waters is loving all the new music in 2010. Here is a great sampling of sunshine for you.
1. Beach House - 10 Mile Stereo (LIVE on KEXP) 2. Miike Snow - Billie Holiday 3. LoneLady - Intuition 4. Blunt Mechanic - Thrown Out At Third 5. Final Spins - Down the Road 6. Roky Erickson with Okkervil River - Goodbye Sweet Dreams 7. Painted Hills - Everybody 8. Bonnie 'Prince' Billy and The Cairo Gang - Troublesome Houses 9. CocoRosie - Lemondade 10. Avi Buffalo - What's In It For? 11. Warpaint - Krimson 12. The Besnard Lakes - Glass Printer 13. Victor Shade - Autograffiti

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 195 - John's Fantastic Podcast
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Here's how Morning Show host John Richards described this week's mix: It rocked and then it went all electronica and then all live in-studio and then it did this acoustic thing at the end. It was fantastic. It was my fantastic podcast.
1. Black Rebel Motorcycle Club - Beat the Devi's Tattoo 2. Dum Dum Girls - Jail La La 3. Love Is All - Bigger Bolder 4. Moon Duo - Motorcycle I Love You 5. Ceremony - Someday 6. Keepaway - Yellow Wings 7. Tanlines - Real Live (Live on KEXP) 8. Cults - Go Outside 9. Jason Collett - Love Is A Dirty Word 10. Dinosaur Feathers - I Ni Sogoma 11. Damien Jurado - Arkansas 12. Motopony - Wait For Me (Live on KEXP) 13. Jay Reatard - Pull Down The Shades

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 194 - Kicking It Out at SXSW 2010
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Shannon kicks out her Best of SXSW bands, featuring "I've-been-blown-away" live tracks from new faves The Crayon Fields, Capsula and Choir of Young Believers. She also stirs up some Surfer Blood, Warpaint and Local Natives into the best new band mix. Keep Austin Weird!
1. The Crayon Fields - All the Pleasures of the World (Live on KEXP) 2. Local Natives - Sun Hands 3. Oh No Ono - Internet Warrior 4. Warpaint - Elephants 5. Choir of Young Believers - Action/Reaction (Live on KEXP) 6. Pepper Rabbit - None Shall Sleep 7. Fanfarlo - Luna (Live on KEXP) 8. Surfer Blood - Twin Peaks 9. Laurel Collective - Fax of Death 10. Princeton - Calypso Gold 11. Real Estate - Fake Blues 12. Summer Cats - Lonely Planet 13. A Sunny Day in Glasgow - Nitetime Rainbows 14. Everything Everything - Tin (the Manhole) (demo) 15. The Middle East - Blood (Live on KEXP) 16. The Kissaway Trail - SDP 17. JEFF the Brotherhood - Heavy Days (Live on KEXP) 18. Plants & Animals - The Mama Papa 19. Capsula - Kicking It Out (Live on KEXP) 20. Ozomatli - Nadas Por Free (Live on KEXP)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 193 - I Got My Mind Made Up
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex unveils his latest exploratory mix of transportive sounds, including everything from futuristic bass-heavy beats and tranquil sleepy-time lullabies to breezy cinematic pop and crafty turntable wizardry! Roll the windows down, turn the volume up, and enjoy.
01. Shlohmo - Hot Boxing the Cockpit 02. Free the Robots - Orion's Belt Buckle 03. Potatofinger - Usurper 04. Ill Cosby - Hold On Dub 05. Golden Ages - Everything Will Be Alright 06. Cults - Go Outside 07. Many Mansions - Sparkly Portal 08. jj - Let Go 09. MillionYoung - Soft Denial 10. Take - Soul Particles 11. Mash Hall - Hi Fivin' My Cousin 12. HEALTH - In Heat (Javelin Remix) 13. Dem Hunger - Horse Stomach 14. Gonjasufi - Ancestors 15. BeanOne - If 6 Was 9 16. Kings Go Forth - Don't Take My Shadow 17. Rob Swift - Spartacuts 18. Oh No Ono - Eleanor Speaks (Caribou Remix) 19. The Seven Fields of Aphelion - Grown 20. Macklemore x Ryan Lewis - The End

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 192 - Spring Fever
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Turn that Spring Fever into a Spring Fling with KEXP's newest Music that Matters Podcast. DJ Rachel Ratner has compiled a mix of some of her favorite new music, including The Lights, White Fence, Whalebones, Unnatural Helpers, Nerve City and more!
1. White Fence - Mr. Adams 2. The Lights - New New 3. Christmas - Winter 4. Puberty - Parties 5. Whalebones - Love is a Desert 6. Shannon and the Clams - You Can Come Over 7. Unnatural Helpers - Sunshine Pretty Girls 8. Eel Eater - Garden Gnome 9. Grave Babies - Eating Babies 10. Stephanie - Love for Sale 11. Smith Westerns - Girl in Love 12. Thousands - Everything Turned Upsidedown 13. Medication - Don't Die 14. Thunder Buffalo - This is my life 15. Nerve City - I am alive 16. Meercaz - future news 17. Spencey Dude and the Doodles - If this Feeling Ends

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 191 - Hymns For The Misguided
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
From the High Places of his Mansion of Los Feliz, DJ Kevin Cole teams up with a Spy from
Cairo to kick some ass on Cinco De Mayo. Dessa, Rocky Votolato, Toro Y Moi, and The
Souljazz Orchestra join this ragtag group of misfits, ready to bring it on!
1. Miles Kurosky - An Apple For An Apple 2. Gospel Gossip - Sippy Cup 3. Golden Triangle - Cinco De Mayo 4. Dessa - Children's Work 5. Field Music - Each Time Is A New Time 6. Toro Y Moi - Blessa 7. High Places - On Giving Up 8. The Spy From Cairo - Sufi Disco 9. Rocky Votolato - Red River 10. Eels - Mansions of Los Feliz 11. Hurricane Lanterns - For Loren 12. Sambassadeur - I Can Try 13. The Souljazz Orchestra - Agbara

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 189 - Don Slack's New Jams
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
While he's the host of KEXP's twang show Swingin' Doors, Don loves all kinds of music. Here are some of his favorite new songs.
1. Title Tracks - Steady Love 2. Jay Reatard - Pull Down the Shades 3. Past Lives - Paralyzer 4. Moon Duo - Stumbling 22nd St. 5. Quasi - Laissez Les Bons Temps Rouler 6. Drive-By Truckers - This Fucking Job 7. Deadstring Brothers - Houston 8. Hurricane Lanterns - Besides Those Things 9. Quakers on Probation - Marysville 10. Choc Quib Town - De Donde Vengo Yo 11. Freeway and Jake One - Microphone Killa 12. Helladope - Shine On

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 188 - John Be Drinkin'
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John Be Drinkin': the new podcast of brand new music The Morning Show is excited about. While John actually is sober, he doesn't appear to be in this mix of brand new jams from all over the world and crammed together into one confusing and crazed podcast.
1. MillionYoung - Hammock 2. ent - No Tone 3. Washed Out - New Theory 4. Reporter - Lab Test 5. Jookabox - Phantom Don't Go 6. Bear Hands - What a Drag 7. Frightened Rabbit - Swim Until You Can't See Land 8. Fences - Sadie 9. Title Tracks - Every Little Bit Hurts 10. Fitz and The Tantrums - Winds of Change (LIVE on KEXP) 11. Gigi - No, My Heart Will Go On 12. My Robot Friend - Misfits Fight Song

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 187 - Safety First Is Not the Daredevil Way!
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Grab your helmet and goggles as Kevin Cole drops new music on your head including Shabazz Palaces, Scout Niblet, Citay, and Eastern Grip.
1. The Magic Kids - Hey Boy 2. Spoon - Written In Reverse 3. Eastern Grip - Everyday We Walked A Little Farther 4. The Depreciation Guild - Dream About Me 5. Class Actress - Let Me Take You Out 6. Terri Tarantula - The Daredevil Way 7. Shabazz Palaces - 32 Leaves... 8. The Whitefield Brothers - The Gift 9. The New Law - Showdown (Fanu Remix) feat. Lokeye & Michael Harris) 10. Yeasayer - Ambling Alp 11. Citay - Dream Get Together 12. Scout Niblett - Just Do It 13. The Besnard Lakes - Like the Ocean, Like Innocent, Pt 1: The Ocean 14. The Besnard Lakes - Like the Ocean, Like Innocent, Pt 2: The Innocent

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 186 - None Shall Sleep
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Cheryl Waters presents the latest Music That Matters podcast: "There is so much great new music coming out right now it's hard to get any sleep. So much music. So little time. Here is an eclectic sampling of some great new stuff, along with a few gems from the past couple of years. Enjoy. And, sweet dreams."
1. Midlake - Acts of Man 2. Eels - Mansions of Los Feliz 3. J. Tillman - Steel On Steel 4. Spoon - Written In Reverse 5. Young Galaxy - Swing Your Heartache 6. Nacao Zumbi - Carimbo 7. Soulico - El Nur (LIVE on KEXP) 8. Asobi Seksu - Thursday 9. Bloodgroup - My Arms 10. Pepper Rabbit - None Shall Sleep 11. JEFF the Brotherhood - Heavy Days 12. The Soft Pack - Answer To Yourself 13. Noddy - Dig a Hole

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 185 - John on Vacation!
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Morning Show host John Richards gets all international on you in his latest effort to supply both new music and geography in one long entertaining and informative podcast, which hops the music hubs of the world: Paris, Mali, Sweden, Iceland, Seattle, Athens, Portland, New York, DC, LA and, of course, Tacoma.
1. Motopony - Seer 2. Chris Joss - Re-Volt 3. Bassekou Kouyate and Ngoni ba - Musow 4. El Perro Del Mar - Gotta Get Smart 5. Ólöf Arnalds - Klara 6. Hoquiam - On The Beach 1987 7. Shout Out Louds - Walls 8. Twin Tigers - Red Fox Run 9. Quasi - Repulsion 10. Thieving Irons - Ashes On The Riverbank 11. Bluebrain - Royal Blue 12. Kids and Animals - Dirty City 13. One Am Radio - An Old Photo of Your New Lover

item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole brings plenty of twists and turns to this alluring musical mix.

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 183 - Cold Medicine
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
KEXP DJ Rachel Ratner presents a smattering of her favorite tracks right now, many of them from San Fransisco's exploding lo-fi 60s influenced garage rock scene. Let's party.
1. Christmas Island - I Don't Care 2. Deep sht - hector 3. Jacuzzi Boys - Planet of the Dreamers 4. Hobocop - Good News 5. Le Sang Song - Gingerella 6. Grass Widow - To Where 7. Explode into Colors - Paper (hot sax version) 8. Greg Ashley - Corporation Station Agent (Apple Pie and Genocide) 9. The Fresh and Onlys - Endless Love 10. Ty Segall - Can't Talk 11. The Mantles - Don't Lie 12. The Spits - Flag 13. Woven Bones - Janie 14. Wet Paint - It is Therapeutic 15. Wounded Lion - Friendly?
item.itunes:subtitle:
KEXP DJ Rachel Ratner presents a smattering of her favorite tracks right now, many of them from San Fransisco's exploding lo-fi 60s influenced garage rock scene. Let's party.
1. Christmas Island - I Don't Care 2. Deep sht - hector 3. Jacuzzi Boys - Planet of the Dreamers 4. Hobocop - Good News 5. Le Sang Song - Gingerella 6. Grass Widow - To Where 7. Explode into Colors - Paper (hot sax version) 8. Greg Ashley - Corporation Station Agent (Apple Pie and Genocide) 9. The Fresh and Onlys - Endless Love 10. Ty Segall - Can't Talk 11. The Mantles - Don't Lie 12. The Spits - Flag 13. Woven Bones - Janie 14. Wet Paint - It is Therapeutic 15. Wounded Lion - Friendly?

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 182 - Wave Backwards to...
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Cheryl Waters presents the latest Music That Matters podcast: "Before we turn the page to a new year and get too far into 2010, I want to take a moment to look back at some gems from 2008 and 2009 (and one each from 2007 and 2003). I feel so grateful to be surrounded by such great music and be a part of a community of music lovers at KEXP. I hope you enjoy these songs from the last decade. This is already shaping up to be another incredible year in music. I look forward to discovering another decade of awesome sounds with you."
1. The Cute Lepers - Smart Accessories 2. Shake Some Action - Get It Together 3. The Purrs - Stay Here With Me 4. Japanese Motors - Better Trends 5. Metric - Combat Baby 6. Hallelujah The Hills - Allied Lions 7. Bob Mould - I'm Sorry, Baby, But You Can't Stand In My Light Anymore 8. Polvo - Beggar's Bowl 9. Ramona Falls - I Say Fever 10. Stars - The Ghost of Genova Heights 11. Apostle of Hustle - Soul Unwind 12. Port O'Brien - I Woke Up Today 13. Of Montreal - An Eluardian Instance 14. Curumin - Compacto

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 181 - The Good, The New and The Epic
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John Richards mixes some of his favorites of 2010 along with exclusive songs from late 2009 that include some longer epic tracks mixed with some upbeat rockers.
1. Edward Sharpe and The Magnetic Zeros - Home 2. Freelance Whales - Generator^Second Floor 3. Phoenix - Love Like A Sunset (Animal Collective Remix) 4. Animal Collective - What Would I Want? Sky 5. CFCF - Monolith 6. Gui Boratto - No Turning Back (Wighnomy's Likkalize Love Rekksmi) 7. Islands - Shining 8. Kunk - No Way 9. Sleigh Bells - Crown on the Ground 10. Bang Bang Eche - Fist Full of Dollars (Live on KEXP) 11. Head Like a Kite - Director's Cut 12. Dylan In The Movies - Josephine If You Only Knew

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 180 - Lucid Dream or Real Life
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole brings you a mix of current faves that'll have you asking "is this a dream or real life?" Current faves from Dave Rawlings Machine, Spain, Library Science and live performances from DeVotchKa and the Moondoggies.
1. Best Coast - When I'm With You 2. Vivian Girls - I Can't Stay (Live at KEXP Volume Five) 3. Pants Yell! - Cold Hands 4. Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings - I Got A Thing On My Mind 5. Think About Life - Set You On Fire 6. Library Science - The Race 7. The Moondoggies - Save My Soul/Changing (Live at KEXP Volume Five) 8. Spain - I'm Still Free 9. Dave Rawlings Machine - Bells Of Harlem 10. DeVotchKa - How It Ends (Live at KEXP Volume Five) 11. Keith Canisius - Lucidity 12. Ernest Gonzales - Self Awakening (Faunts Remix)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 178 - Let Go of the Fear
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Cheryl Waters presents a new mix of her current favorites, featuring a healthy dose of NW artists and enough beats, rock and grooves to take your mind off what ails ya.
1. Javelin - TWYCE 2. BK-One with Benzilla - The True and Living (ft. Raekwon and I Self Devine) 3. People Under the Stairs - Trippin' at the Disco 4. Betsy Olson - Waitin' 5. Fungi Girls - Dystopic Vision 6. Willowz - Destruction 7. Pufferfish - Wrecking Ball 8. Friday Mile - Lives of Strangers 9. The Crayon Fields - Mirrorball 10. Feral Children - On a Frozen Beach 11. Stripmall Architecture - We Wear Strings (LIVE on KEXP) 12. Beach House - Norway 13. Karl Blau - Dark Sedan 14. Maps - Let Go of the Fear 15. Elba - Wide Awake

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
In this breakthrough podcast, idealist DJ Kevin Cole and his kung fu fighting band of bands go ballistic on your ears! Includes Mexican Chili Taco Fiesta, The Bats, Laura Veirs and Gospel Gossip.

Macklemore - The Town 8. You Say Party! We Say Die! - Laura Palmer's Prom 9. Frank Turner - The Road 10. Gospel Gossip - Pre-Med (Just In Case) 11. Espers - Another Moon Song 12. Virgin Islands - The Age Of Anxiety 13. Mexican Chili Taco Fiesta - Tamales Oaxaquenos

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 175 - Pitch A Fit
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 175
item.description:
The days are getting shorter and darker and colder in Seattle. Brrrr. It's dark when you wake up and dark when you leave work. But even on the darkest and dreariest of days, you have a reason to be happy: because KEXP is here for you to listen to all day long. In this podcast, Cheryl Waters offers just a sampling of the beautiful and the bright and sunny tunes that she's singing and dancing along with right now.
1. Rodrigo and Gabriela - Hanuman 2. The Scotland Yard Gospel Choir - Sixteen Is Too Young 3. The Clientele - Harvest Time 4. Grand Archives - Oslo Novelist 5. Califone - Funeral Singers 6. The Maldives - Goodbye 7. Jason Lytle - Ghost of My Old Dog 8. Maserati - Monoliths 9. Vitalic - Poison Lips 10. Sin Fang Bous - Catch The Light 11. Little Pieces - One Million Feet Below 12. Port O'Brien - Leap Year 13. We All Have Hooks For Hands - Made Up Of Tiny Lights 14. Who Knew - Made Believe 15. Slender Means - Pitch a Fit

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 174 - Rachel Ratner's Cartographic Study of Musical Incest
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Ever hear of 6-degrees of Kevin Bacon? Join DJ Rachel Ratner as she explores the interconnectedness of the Northwest's music scene.
1. The Shackles - Way Before We Got Orphan Blues 2. The Charming Snakes - Love Life 3. Coconut Coolouts - Tireshredding 4. Lamborghiniz - Take Them Drawls Off 5. The Lights - Nervous Breakdown 6. Love Tan - This Land is No Good 7. Factums - When 8. Intelligence - Astrology 9. Popular Shapes - Elevator Friends 10. Charles Leo Gebhardt IV - Look Out, Look In 11. Unnatural Helpers - Out of Touch 12. Double Fudge - Check Me Out for Yourself Take You For a Ride 13. Idle Times - Track 2 14. White Nights - Lights Out pt. 2 15. The Trashies - Science Suks 16. Spurm - Motivation 17. Partman Parthorse - Significant Bummer 18. Butts - Alcohol 19. K.H.V. - Crushin' Out! 20. The Hands - Arrows 21. The Hacks - Tiny Bones 22. Fee Fi Fo Fum - At the Funhouse 23. The Dutchess AND THE Duke - Scorpio 24. The Pulses - Future Home 25. Scraps Apollo - Scraps 26. Bird Language - Hard Not to Behave 27. Electric Blanket - Catch My Sister on Fire 28. Swimmers - Hot Pocket 29. consignment - Always Tired 30. Meth Teeth - Unemployment Forever

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 173 - A Little Less Homesick
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
This "creepy yet exciting" Music That Matters podcast was recorded in a hidden basement in Brooklyn by John Richards and features the very best in the new music being played on the Morning Show with a ton of Seattle bands in the mix... making John feel a little less homesick.
1. Big Spider's Back - Perfect Machine 2. Islands - Vapour 3. The Mary Onettes - Dare 4. The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart - Higher Than The Stars 5. Drummer - Feel Good Together 6. Lou Barlow - Sharing 7. Fitz & The Tantrums - Breakin' The Chains Of Love 8. King Khan & BBQ Show - Invisible Girl 9. No Age - You're A Target 10. Nirvana - Scoff (live at the Pine Street Theatre, Portland) 11. BLK JKS - Lakeside 12. Lusine- Two Dots 13. Head Like A Kite - Thrones Of Glory 14. ZAZA - Sooner Or Later

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 172 - More Noise With Less Noise
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Kevin Cole brings the noise. Warning: after listening to this podcast, you'll be running down the street in your underwear.

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Street Sounds host Larry Mizell Jr. brings a podcast of bangin' hip-hop from all over the map, figuratively and literally, with a healthy dose of hometown love.

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 169 - Whacked Out and Venting
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 169 - Whacked Out and Venting
item.description:
A delirious John Richards presents a collection of songs recorded smack in the middle of the 2009 Fall Membership Drive, but even while whacked out and venting, he still manages to pull out great new tune after another.
1. Middle East - Blood 2. Volcano Choir - Island, IS 3. Port Royal - The Photoshopped Prince 4. ArpLine - Cap (demo) 5. A Sunny Day in Glasgow - Failure 6. The Heavy - How Do You Like Me Now 7. Turbo Fruits - Want Some Mo 8. Visqueen - Hand Me Down 9. Sissy Wish - Float 10. Pretty Good Dance Moves - Leave Me Alone 11. Port O'Brien - My Will Is Good 12. Mason Jennings - City of Ghosts 13. The Blakes - So Easy 14. Pixie Carnation - When Did The Lights Go Out 15. Mum - If I Were A Fish

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 168 - Locals and Beyond, A Fall Mix
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 168 - Locals and Beyond, A Fall Mix
item.description:
Join new overnight host DJ Tim as he brings you his current mix of local faves, nationals and
beyond. All of the songs collected in this fall playlist remind him of his favorite time of year.
So grab a warm sweater, get ready to watch the leaves fall, and enjoy.
1. Shenandoah Davis - Proof 2. Flexions - Fated Occupations 3. Miike Snow - Song For No One 4. Throw Me the Statue - Pistols 5. Le Loup - Forgive Me 6. Bird Announced Land - Sweet Dreams 7. Thee Satisfaction - Waltz 8. Black Whales - Diamond Divide 9. The Crayon Fields - All the Pleasures of the World 10. Slow Skate - Until your Satisfied

item.description:
Step into the musical kitchen with Afternoon Show DJ Kevin Cole! He's serving up nothing but great new music, with heaping spoonfuls of dreamy electronica, energetic power-pop, and foot-tappin' country tinged rock... Dig in!

Speech Debelle - Spinnin' 8. D. Black - Yah Have Mercy 9. Mason Jennings - The Field 10. The Maldives - Blood Relations 11. The Foghorns - Old Bachelors in Cleveland 12. Still Life Still - Pastel Girls

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 166 - Spotlight on Decibel Festival 2009
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex shines a spotlight on select artists performing at this year's 6th annual Decibel Festival, Seattle's premier electronic music and arts event. Running from September 24-27, Decibel Festival will feature over 100 acts from 10 different countries, 30 of which will be making their live NW debut! Tune in to get a taste of this year's diverse and stacked roster, and check out www.dbfestival.com for more information!
1. Nosaj Thing - Lords 2. Nalepa - Flatlands (Nosaj Thing Remix) 3. Michna - Bumper Car Masters 4. Take - Northbound 5. [a]pendics.shuffle - Saw Saw Soup (Robag Wruhme Remix) 6. Mike Slott - Knock Knock 7. Sub Swara - Hi Fidelity (Shambhala Riddim) 8. Tim Exile - There's Nothing Left Of Me But Her And This 9. The Gaslamp Killer - Baiafro 10. Daedelus - I Took Two 11. Pezzner - Chapter_Two 12. Lusine - Gravity 13. Tycho - The Daydream 14. Benoit Pioulard - Hesperus 15. Mountains - Map Table 16. Christopher Willits - The Greatest Rain

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 164 - Modern Metal Worth Mining
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Heavy metal has always been a resilient genre with a fiercely devoted fan base, but in the last several years, an impressive strain of punk informed, independent metal artists have emerged, forging elements of classic hard rock to the brash spirit of underground and post-punk artists. What follows is a survey of some of the best newer artists operating in this genre, along with one deliciously noisy history lesson from one of its early frontrunners, the late, great Karp.
1. Children - Advanced Mind Control 2. Akimbo - Great White Bull 3. Red Fang - Prehistoric Dog 4. Black Elk - Stab 5. Big Business - I Got It On The Internet 6. Karp - Forget The Minions 7. Helms Alee - New Roll 8. The Sword - Frost Giant's Daughter 9. Mico de Noche - Magic Tomorrow 10. These Arms Are Snakes - Woolen Heirs

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Morning Show host John Richards brings you this podcast just in time for geography class -- 15 songs, 8 locations (NYC, Seattle, Scotland, Spain, Tacoma, LA, New Zealand, Hell).

Dave Bazan - Bless This Mess 7. The Twilight Sad - Reflection Of Television 8. The Nightgowns - Animal Sound 9. The Clean - In The Dreamlife You Need A Rubber Soul 10. Falcatross - Momentum 11. Xylos - In The Bedroom 12. Pablo - Morning 13. Pela - Augustine (from Live at KEXP Volume Five) 14. Grand Hallway - Raindrops 15. Dead Man's Bones - My Body's A Zombie For You

item.description:
Kevin Cole presents the annual sneak preview of the Bumbershoot Music and Arts Festival, happening on Labor Day weekend, Sept 5-7. Listen to some of KEXP's favorite bands playing the festival at large and at our exclusive Music Lounge, which you can sign up for at www.kexp.org.
1. Hey Marseilles - From A Terrace (from Live at KEXP Volume Five) 2. Hotels - Kite Fight 3. Matt and Kim - Daylight 4. Natalie Portman's Shaved Head - Me + Yr Daughter 5. Akron/Family - Set 'Em Free 6. Common Market - Escaping Arkham 7. Gang Gang Dance - House Jam 8. Metric - Gun Gold Girls 9. The Whore Moans - Holy Fucking Moment (from Live at KEXP Volume Five) 10. Vivian Girls - All The Time 11. Michael Franti and Spearhead - Yell Fire 12. Sera Cahoone - Only As The Day Is Long 13. The Helio Sequence - Can't Say No 14. Point Juncture, WA - Melon Bird 15. item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex burns through 20 tracks that have recently made him go, "Damn! That's fresh!" Packed with new local cuts, funky psychedelic jams, breezy tropical sounds, and intense rhythmic excursions, "Beats Ablaze" is sure to soothe sunburns and melt minds. Enjoy!
1. Leyode - Elizabeth Chateau 2. Nosaj Thing - Coat of Arms 3. Grynch - Chemistry (f. One Be Lo) 4. Machine Drum - Let It (f. Melo-X) 5. Toro Y Moi - Blessa 6. Bibio - Jealous of Roses 7. Big Spider's Back - Warped 8. Yppah - Bobbie Joe Wilson 9. Clark - Growls Garden 10. Bike For Three! - Nightdriving 11. Sleepy Eyes of Death - Crushed By Stars (Truckasauras Remake) 12. The Gaslamp Killer - Anything Worse 13. Pictureplane - Goth Star 14. Black Mold - Finally Someone Invented A Teleporter! 15. Memory Cassette - Surfin (Sail A Whale Version) 16. Netherfriends - Nunya 17. City Center - Bleed Blood 18. Universal Studios Florida - Old Spooky and Moss Hut 19. Shad - I Heard You Had A Voice Like An Angel / Psalm 137 20. Mochipet - Roll Credits

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 159 - Lust for Life: Thoughts of PJ
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
This week's podcast was recorded while thinking of much loved KEXP volunteer, member, listener and friend PJ Welsh, who was struggling to hold onto life as she battled organ failure. A consummate music lover, PJ shared her enthusiasm and generosity with so many around her. She inspired me with her passion for so many things, music and otherwise, and with her lust for life.
1. The Cinematic Orchestra - To Build a Home 2. Star Anna and the Laughing Dogs - Through the Winter 3. Dear Tick - Easy 4. The Features - Lions 5. The Boy Least Likely To - Saddle Up 6. Final Spins - Let Me Fall 7. Earlimart - Song For 8. Caribou - Melody Day 9. Hey Marseilles - Rio 10. Eels - Fresh Blood 11. Jeremy Enigk - In a Look 12. Hypatia Lake - The General's Gleaming Edge 13. Viva Voce - Devotion 14. The Low Frequency In Stereo - Texas Fox 15. Minus The Bear - Knights 16. Bomba Estereo - Fuego

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 158 - Temperate Times
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Breeze your way through DJ Shannon's warm seasonal mix and explore her latest international jams from The Temper Trap, Post War Years, The Silent Years, The Twilight Sad, Mew and Sad Day for Puppets, among others. Boost your mood immediately with feel good tunes.
1. The Temper Trap - Sweet Disposition 2. Post War Years - Whole World on Its Head 3. Plugs - All Them Witches 4. Chew Lips - Salt Air 5. Mad Rad - Sexy Bicycle 6. Fresh Espresso - Girls and Fast Cars 7. Engineers - Sometimes I Realise 8. Trailer Trash Tracys - Strangling Good Guys 9. The Twilight Sad - I Became A Prostitute 10. Mew - RepeaterBeater 11. Grizzly Bear - Cheerleader 12. Sad Day for Puppets - Little Light 13. The Silent Years - Taking Drugs At The Amusement Park 14. Alessi's Ark - Magic Weather

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 156 - Northwest Festival Preview
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Sunshine, drum circles and water parks aren't the only things that the summer months have to offer, there's also music festivals! DJ Sharlese gives you a preview of three summer festivals she's excited to attend: The Capitol Hill Block Party, What The Heck Fest, and PDX Pop Now! Yay for Summer!
1. Japandroids - Young Hearts Spark Fire 2. The Maldives - By The Wind Sailor (Live @ KEXP) 3. Mika Miko - Beat The Rush 4. They Live - Meth Heads 5. Cryptacize - Mythomania 6. Grouper - Heavy Water/I'd Rather Be Sleeping 7. The Vibrarians - The Woods 8. Arrington de Dionyso - Kedalaman Air 9. Benoit Poulard - Idyll 10. At Dusk - For a Reason 11. Magic Johnson - Las Malas 12. Dykeritz - Chasing the Wheel Away 13. Ethan Rose and Laura Gibson - Sun
