item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 154 - Big Gay Podcast 2009
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
40 years after the Stonewall riots, the musical landscape of the queer community is more diverse than ever. For the 2009 edition of the "Big Gay Podcast," DJ El Toro rustled up tracks by 15 openly gay and lesbian artists or bands with prominent LGBT members, from Seattle and around the globe. From moody instrumentals and histrionic electronics, to tongue-in-cheek punk rock and a double-dose of lesbian hip hop, there's something for everyone on this special Pride podcast.
1. Grizzly Bear - He Hit Me (And It Felt Like A Kiss) 2. Thalia Zedek Band - We Don't Go 3. Flare - 4F 4. Final Fantasy - The Butcher 5. Lovers - How The Story Ends 6. Erik Blood - To Leave America 7. Yo! Majesty - Kryptonite Pussy 8. Team Gina - Butch/Femme 9. Khan of Finland - Who Never Rests 10. Circlesquare - Ten To One 11. The Redwood Plan - Expiration 12. Bob Mould - Argos 13. Tara Jane O'Neil - Pearl In Sand 14. Abe Vigoda - Heart 15. Hunx and His Punx - You Don't Like Rock N Roll

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 150 - No Fun: DJ Shani's Summertime Podcast!
item.itunes:author: assorted
item.description:
Explore DJ Shani's favorite new songs on her latest podcast. Travel to France, Poland, England, Germany, Portugal, and the US of A! Listen to some electronic beats, experimental landscapes, lo-fi garage rock, lazy summertime pop, and more. You'll find your favorite new songs for driving on a sunny summer's day, walking home on a warm summer's night, or lounging on the porch with a mint julep... or make that the beach... mmmm.
1. Sonny and The Sunsets - Strange Love 2. Dreamdate - 8 Sleeves 3. Dirty Projectors - Stillness is the Move 4. Vampire Hands - No Fun 5. Chain and The Gang - I See Progress 6. Moderat - Rusty Nails 7. Gala Drop - Crystal 8. Papercuts - Once We Walked in the Sunlight 9. Bibio - Carosello Ellitico 10. Night Control - Good Looks 11. Thee Oh Sees - Meat Step Lively 12. Cheveu - Like A Deer in the Headlights 13. Neon Indian - 6669 (I Don't Know If You Know) 14. Tammar - Weddle On 15. Speck Mountain - Angela 16. Jacaczek - Rytm to Niesmiertelnosc II

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 149 - The Gift That Keeps On Giving
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Kevin Cole does what your closest friend would do: he shares fifteen amazing songs with you including new music from John Vanderslice, Jeremy Enigk, and Superchunk.
1. BrakesBrakesBrakes - Ancient Mysteries 2. I Was A King - Norman Bleik 3. Fanfarlo - The Walls Are Coming Down 4. John Vanderslice - Too Much Time 5. Jeremy Enigk - Life's Too Short 6. Erik Blood - Broken Glass 7. Red Collar - The Astronaut 8. Common Market - Escaping Arkham 9. Bill Callahan - All Beasts Are Prey To Some Beast 10. Conor Oberst and the Mystic Valley Band - Nikorette 11. An Horse - Postcards 12. Superchunk - Misfits and Mistakes 13. Pomegranates - Beachcomber 14. Au Revoir Simone - All Or Nothing 15. Potatofinger - Mocking The Mizer

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 148 - Slow and Pretty
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
You've been waiting for it for nearly 150 podcasts: DJ Riz presents his first ever podcast featuring the kind of sonically beautiful mix you come to expect from his shows. It's like catching Riz on the radio late at night, but now you can take it on the go!
1. Bruno Colais - Fantastic Garden 2. My Brightest Diamond - My Golden Star (Alias mix) 3. Isan - Trois Gymnopedies 4. Nels Cline - Prayer Whee 5. Gutevolk - Planetarium 6. Helios - Halving The Compass 7. Voyager One - Beautiful Wreckage (Disinterested Mix) 8. Last Days - This Is Not An Ending 9. Lotus Plaza - Antoine 10. Do Make Say Think - Frediricia 11. Yasushi Yoshida - Picture Of Three Life 12. The Books - 8 Frame 13. Beach House - Apple Orchard 14. Port Royal - Flares Pt. 3 (Televise mix) 15. Gui Boratto - Godet

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 147 - From the Mess to the Masses
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 147 - From the Mess to the Masses
item.description:
Yowza! Cheryl Waters picks up the pace as she gathers her favorite songs that have come out recently, including a bunch of locals acts like Telekinesis and The Ironclads, blistering tracks from Elliott Brood and Chuck Prophet, and upbeat tunes from BrakesBrakesBrakes, The Thermals, Obits, and more!
1. Neko Case - People Got a Lotta Nerve 2. The Ironclads - Step to the Sea 3. Navigator vs. Navigator - Old Time Radio 4. White Rabbits - Percussion Gun 5. Phoenix - Lisztomania 6. Man Plus - 911 7. Elliott Brood - Fingers and Tongues 8. BrakesBrakesBrakes - Crush On You 9. Telekinesis - Great Lakes 10. Harlem Shakes - Sunlight 11. The Thermals - Now We Can See 12. Cymbals Eat Guitars - Cold Spring 13. Dan Deacon - Paddling Ghost 14. Obits - Pine On 15. Handsome Furs - I'm Confused 16. Parts and Labor - Nowheres Nigh 17. Buraka Som Sistema - Sound of Kuduro feat. DJ Znobia, M.I.A., Puto Prata 18. Chuck Prophet - A Woman's Voice (LIVE ON KEXP)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 146 - Spring Fever
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 146 - Spring Fever
item.description:
You know the feeling. It's kinda still crappy out. But also summer's on the horizon. You want to party. You're craving BBQs and flip flops and hammocks and outdoor beverages. But it's too soon. You have to wait a bit longer. And it's driving you crazy. Fear not, KEXP DJ Rachel brings you some of her new favorite reissues, demos, new releases, and more to tide you over until summer starts for reals! Idle Times! Death! Chain and the Gang! The Lights! Let's get the party started... almost...
1. Pearly Gate Music - Gossimer Hair 2. The Intelligence - Debt and ESP 3. Colossal Yes - A Ballad Is The Air That You Breathe 4. Coconut Coolouts - Nerd Holocaust 5. The Lights - Famous Gunshots 6. Lamborginiz - Chunky Babies 7. Idle Times - Million Miles Away 8. Death - Freakin Out 9. Chain and the Gang - Interview w/ Chain and the Gang 10. They Live - Dro Bots 11. Religious Girls - Delora 12. Red Red Meat - Gauze 13. Triumph of Lethargy Skinned Alive to Death - Charlie Black 14. One Million Teeth - Silver Tongue 15. R. Stevie Moore - A clever combo 16. Herr Jazz - Hey Merlin, Thanks for the Free Coffee 17. Dan Melchior - Citadel

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 145 - The Big Apple and the Emerald City
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John Richards collects some of the best new music from the cities where he spends his time, New York and Seattle, and redefines what is "local" to KEXP.
1. Baby Dayliner - You Push, I'll Go 2. Say Hi - Oh Oh Oh Oh Oh Oh Oh Oh 3. Suckers - Beach Queen 4. The Fascination Movement - Just Pretend 5. Freshkills - Revelations (Nick Zinner Remix) 6. Born Anchors - In Disguise 7. Phosphorescent - Wolves (Live on KEXP) 8. BEADS - Evil 9. Iran - Buddy 10. Dyme Def - 11. Telepathe - So Fine 12. Elks - Collide 13. Matt and Kim - Daylight 14. Panda and Angel - The End Is Not So 15. Wild Yaks - River May Come

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 144 - Make Me Feel Brand New
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex is back with another adventurous mix exposing the latest in neck-breaking underground hip-hop, atmospheric electronic soundscapes, and moody psychedelic rock! With the flowers starting to bloom and the gorgeous Seattle summer looming on the horizon, it's a perfect time to give "Make Me Feel Brand New" a listen and feel refreshed, renewed, and reborn.
1. Exile - Frequency Modulation 2. Bullion - Long Promised 3. Foscil and Specs One - Trees 4. Zion I - Antenna 5. Sol - Road Is Rough 6. Keelay and Zaire - Alright With Me (feat. Dminor and Phonte) 7. Harmonic 313 - Falling Away 8. Yppah - Gumball Machine Weekend 9. Praveen and Benoit - To Scale (Landau Orchestra Remix) 10. Bell Orchestre - Elephants 11. Tammar - Emily's Army 12. Peasant - Exposure13. Sapient - Ellege (Inst.) 14. DM Stith - Pity Dance 15. Nite Club - Eff$ 16. MachineDrum - Late Night Operation (feat. Theophilus London) 17. Kid Sister - Get Fresh 18. Fresh Espresso - Gigantic 19. Big Spider's Back - Mind Grapes 20. Faunts - Feel.Love.Thinking.Of (Faunts Flto Mws Mix) 21. CFCF - You Hear Colours

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 140 - SXSW: High Expectations
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Shannon is off on another new music adventure to Austin for SXSW. She's seeking out the best new bands, as well as her long-time fave Blur guitarist Graham Coxon (exclusive track) from his new solo album.
1. Slow Club - Let's Fall Back in Love 2. Graham Coxon - Sorrow's Army 3. We Were Promised Jetpacks - Ships With Holes Will Sink 4. Peggy Sue - Alice in the Kitchen 5. Come On Gang! - Wheels 6. Shilpa Ray and Her Happy Hookers - Filthy and Free 7. Pete and the Pirates - Bright Lights 8. DANANANANAYKROYD - Pink Sabbath 9. Screaming Tea Party - I'd Rather Be Stuck On The Stair Rail 10. The Transpersonals - Twenty Twelve 11. Late of the Pier - Space and The Woods 12. Friends Electric – Hours 13. We Have Band - Hear It in the Cans 14. Bell - New Bridge

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 139 - Shake Well After Using
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John Richards presents another collection of the latest and greatest from the Morning Show in this Music That Matters podcast, flush with human relationships, bodies of water, the beach, and bonding through good hygiene. Check out new music from Andrew Bird, Harlem Shakes, Balmorhea, and more.
1. Harlem Shakes - Strictly Game 2. See Me River - Ed Jackson 3. Surf City - Dickshakers Union 4. Japandroids - Young Heart Sparks Fire 5. O+S - We Do What We Want To 6. Peter Broderick - And It's Alright 7. The Walkmen - Donde Esta la Playa 8. Balmorhea - Remembrance 9. Andrew Bird - Fitz and Dizzyspells 10. BLK JKS - Lakeside 11. Miike Snow - Burial (Dj Mehdi Remix) 12. Iran - Buddy 13. The Pains of Being Pure at Heart - Stay Alive

1. Harlem Shakes - Strictly Game 2. See Me River - Ed Jackson 3. Surf City - Dickshakers Union 4. Japandroids - Young Heart Sparks Fire 5. O+S - We Do What We Want To 6. Peter Broderick - And It's Alright 7. The Walkmen - Donde Esta la Playa 8. Balmorhea - Remembrance 9. Andrew Bird - Fitz and Dizzyspells 10. BLK JKS - Lakeside 11. Miike Snow - Burial (Dj Mehdi Remix) 12. Iran - Buddy 13. The Pains of Being Pure at Heart - Stay Alive

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 138 - Cabin Fever
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Saturday afternoon host Quilty 3000 brings you a collection of songs guaranteed to chase away winter. Enjoy new local music, upcoming releases, and some current favorites while counting down the days till the Spring Equinox.
1. The Thermals - Now We Can See 2. Gunbunny - Hidden 3. The Pica Beats - Poor Old Ra 4. Say Hi - November Was White December Was Grey 5. Damian Jurado - Gillian Was A Horse 6. Robyn Hitchcock - I'm Falling 7. Mazes - I Have Laid In the Darkness 8. Bob Mould - The Silence Between Us 9. Nada Surf - See These Bones 10. New Ruins - Lake 11. I'm Not Jim - Uncomplicated 12. Horse Feathers - Curs in the Weeds 13. N.A.S.A. - Spacious Thoughts 14. RH+ - Curb

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 137 - Make a Blank Valuable by Putting It in an Exquisite Frame
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
KEXP afternoon show host Kevin Cole shares some of his current faves from around the world. Hear exotic pop from Iceland, bubblegum pop from Scotland, Afro-Latin rhythms from Peru, and new music from Seattle's The Redwood Plan and Hotels. No exquisite frame necessary!
1. Bubblegum Lemonade - A Billion Heartbeats 2. Asobi Seksu - Layers 3. Hotels - Kite Fight 4. The Redwood Plan - Something To Prove 5. Pretty and Nice - Stop/Start 6. Novalima - Coba Guarango 7. Sin Fang Bous - Melt Down The Knives 8. The Hermit Crabs - I Don’t Know How 9. Eleni Mandell - It Wasn’t The Time (It Was the Color) 10. Robyn Hitchcock - Up To Our Nex 11. Tommy Keene - Tomorrow’s Gone Tonight 12. Kinky - Fuego En La Fabrica 13. Late of the Pier - Space and the Woods 14. Branden Daniel and Everybody Gets Laid - Lua

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 136 - Something About A Piano
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ El Toro thinks the folks at Steinway and Sons slipped something in his drink. He entered the KEXP production studios with no greater intention than to compile some of his favorite new tunes. But when his podcast was finished, there seemed to be a lot of pianos - some grand, some not so - and even a Casiotone in the mix. Then again, at least one ukulele pops up, too, so perhaps he's paranoid. But if you find yourself feeling compelled to play "Chopsticks" after listening, please notify the proper authorities at once.
1. Hauschka - Tagtraum 2. Eleni Mandell - Personal 3. Circlesquare - Dancers 4. Psapp - Fickle Ghost 5. Azita - How Will You 6. The Bad Plus - Fém 7. Dent May and His Magnificent Ukulele - Meet Me in the Garden 8. Vetiver - Another Reason to Go 9. Free Blood - Royal Family 10. Kurt Vile - Freeway 11. Spook the Horse - Jackrabbit 12. Ursula 1000 - I.C.O.M.E. 13. Telefon Tel Aviv - Helen of Troy 14. Sleepy Eyes of Death - Pulse from Breath 15. Seeland - Colour Dream 16. Casiotone for the Painfully Alone - Lesley Gore on the T.A.M.I. Show 17. Ran Blake - You Are My Sunshine

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 135 - Local Variety Dance Party Mix
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Audioasis Producer Sharlese and her assistant Reese have a lot in common, including a shared appreciation for cupcakes and pounding the pavement in search of new and exciting bands from the Northwest. Indulge your sweet tooth in some of their favorite Northwest finds of the beginning of 2009.
1. Fresh Espresso - Show Me How You Do 2. The Beats, Man - Freedomtown 3. Photosynthesis - 9th Street 4. KHV (Katharine Hepburn's Voice) - Crushin' Out 5. Weekend - Tait Toi Sois Belle 6. Grynch - It's Go Time 7. TacocaT - Volcano 8. Dyme Def - 3 Bad Brothaaas (remix) 9. The Last Slice of Butter - Family 10. D. Black - On The Go 11. CMYK - Last Dance

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 134 - Your Style Won't Survive You
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 134
item.description:
Join DJ Alex for a funky fresh mix of kinetic new tunes that will leave you shaking your booty, tickling your brain, and bobbing your head to the sounds of the underground.
1. Balmorhea - Settler 2. Koushik - Welcome 3. Flying Lotus - Camel (Nosaj Thing Remix) 4. Osborne - Hydragilm Exit 5. Destruments - The Get Down 6. Calmer - Past Is Present 7. KILN - Marigold Bunker 8. New Villager - Rich Doors 9. Ariel Pink's Haunted Graffiti - Can't Hear My Eyes 10. Tussle - Elephants Meandering (Sal Principato and Dennis Young Remix) 11. Roots Manuva - Let the Spirit (Hot Chip Remix) 12. Zion I - DJ DJ 13. Buraka Som Sistema - D...D...D...D...Jay 14. Home Video - I Can Make You Feel It 15. KiD CuDi - Day 'n' Nite (Jori Hulkkonen Remix) 16. Grampall Jookabox - Let's Go Mad Together 17. The Bran Flakes - What It's All About 18. Charles Trees - Memories 19. CYNE - Fall Through Atlantis 20. Aether - Anywhere 21. Hudson Mohawke - Star Crackout 22. Hauschka - Freibad 23. Dyme Def - Fresh In My Kicks 24. Circle Research - This Is A Recording 25. Black Milk - Give the Drummer Sum 26. Eliot Lipp - Sentinel 27. Benoît Pioulard - Ragged Tint 28. Marie Siouxx - Love Song 29. Daedelus - C'Est Super 30. Surkin - Chrome Knight (f. Chromeo) 31. Lemonade - Big Weekend (Delorean Remix)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 133 - That's What She Said
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
2009 is off to a great start, what with sunny days in Seattle, the startings of change in D.C., "Lost" starting up again... and some great music too! On her 4th podcast, DJ Shani presents new songs that are getting her revved up for another kickass year of music.
1. The Week That Was - It's All Gone Quiet 2. Minotaur Shock - This Plane is Going To Fall 3. Wet Hair - Saturn 4. Wizzard Sleeve - Pterodactyl Meltdown 5. That Ghost - Open Windows 6. Yussuf Jerusalem - Greetings From Novi Sad 7. Palms - Monte Alban 8. Telepathe - The Devil's Trident 9. Grouper - Heavy Water/I'd Rather Be Sleeping 10. Cold Cave - The Trees Grew Emotions and Died 11. Fennesz - Saffron Revolution 12. Suzy Mangion - Many Happy Returns 13. Ulaan Khol - Untitled III 14. Donovan Quinn and The 13th Month - Dark Motel 15. Fire on Fire - Assanine Race 16. Zu - Erinys 17. Meneguar - Let Us Decide 18. Hunx and His Punx - Gimmie Gimmie Back Your Love

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 132 - Second Sonic Reducer Punkcast
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Welcome to the Music that Matters Punkcast. Join Sonic Reducer co-host Nick Turner for a tasting of 2008's best loud, fast, abrasive and generally disconcerting sounds. Fresh misanthropic tendencies, served with a side of lo-fi weirdness. Cocktail attire suggested.
1. Sex Vid - Footsteps 2. Mayyors -?? 3. Mutators - Forever 4. Kim Phuc - Wormwood Star 5. Snake Apartment - Pigs is Pigs 6. AFCGT - Lost 7. Lords of Light - Just a Taste 8. Pig Heart Transplant - untitled 9. Running for Cover - Tunnels 10. Failures - Crowning Achievement 11. Cult Ritual - Guiltless/Electric Depression 12. Men's Interest - untitled 13. Mentally Challenged - False False Memories 14. Mind Eraser - Unconscious

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 129 - DJ Shannon's 2008 Favourite Things
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Many of DJ Shannon's past podcast songs are on her top albums of 2008. Let's review another awesome year for music with live Helio Sequence, The Last Shadow Puppets, Of Montreal, plus her #1 album faves Foals.
1. Foals - Balloons 2. MGMT - Time to Pretend 3. The Last Shadow Puppets - Standing Next to Me (Live) 4. Frightened Rabbit - Old Old Fashioned 5. Mason Proper - Lock and Key 6. The Helio Sequence - Can't Say No 7. Wild Beasts - Brave Buldging Bouyant Clairvoyants 8. Of Montreal - An Eluardian Instance (Live on KEXP) 9. Fleet Foxes - Oliver James (from "Live at KEXP Volume Four") 10. Lykke Li - I'm Good I'm Gone 11. Chairlift - Evident Utensil 12. Hercules and Love Affair - Hercules Theme 13. South - Better Things 14. British Sea Power - Waving Flags

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 128 - You Can't Say Baby Butt Pants
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John Richards takes a break from making year-end Top 10 lists to gather some of his favorite songs of 2008 that might have been off the radar and not on a lot of critics' lists. And, as he looks ahead to the future, could it be "Baby Butt Pants" topping next year's lists? That's Arlie's prediction anyway.
1. Secret Machines - Now You're Gone 2. Talkdemonic - Duality Of Deathening 3. School of Seven Bells - Face To Face on High Places 4. David Byrne and Brian Eno - Strange Overtones 5. Quiet Village - Keep On Rolling 6. Flying Lotus - Camel 7. Fannypack - The Theme from Frank 8. The Very Sexuals - Carla 9. The Moondoggies - Changing 10. AC Berkheimer - For He's Not There 11. Autodrone - Strike A Match 12. Love Is All - Wishing Well 13. Longwave - No Direction 14. James Yorkston - When the Haar Rolls In

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 127 - NW Series #5: South Puget Sound
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Sharlese continues her series of regional Northwest bands, this time focusing on the variety of sounds coming from the south of Puget Sound. In this volume, you'll hear a selection of bands and artists mainly from Tacoma, WA, but also from Auburn and Olympia.
1. Paris Spleen - Tamby 2. People Under The Sun - Weird Liars In Love 3. Friskey - Hershey Kiss 4. Wallpaper - Shag Carpet 5. Makeup Monsters - Calamine 6. The Elephants - Humans Extinct 7. David Wolf - Nocnitsa feat. Jesse Hill of The Next Door Neighbors 8. Clemm Rishad - Sky 9. Kusikia - Heart 10. The Drug Purse - Upside Down Girl 11. Umber Sleeping - The Sky Show 12. Don’t Tell Sophie - Look No Cavities 13. The Fucking Eagles - Out Of This World 14. Can-U - Don’t Walk Away 15. Lozen - So Long

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 126 - From Stardust to Sentience
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
On his latest podcast, Afternoon Show host Kevin Cole ascends to transcendence with High Places, enters the majestic School of Seven Bells, and spools out the heavenly Weird Tapes. Fourteen songs -- all soaringly good!
1. The Lucksmiths - Good Light 2. Gang Gang Dance - House Jam 3. Fort Knox Five - Sao Funky 4. I Led 3 Lives - House of Ahmet 5. High Places - From Stardust to Sentience 6. School of Seven Bells - Iamundernodisguise 7. Weird Tapes - The Heavens 8. Marianne Dissard - Le Lendemain 9. Butcher The Bar - Sex Szene 10. Larkin Grimm - Ride That Cyclone 11. caUSE co-MOTION! - Which Way Is Up? 12. Private Dancer - She's A Company Man 13. Parts and Labor - Nowheres Nigh 14. The Tough Alliance - Neo Violence

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 125 - The Truth
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Yo, it’s definitely time for you to add another hip-hop mixtape to your collection. KEXP’s DJ Chilly collects some of his favorite tracks from 2008 for this uninterrupted mix: 80 minutes of hip-hop’s finest MCs, DJs and producers. There’s a wide range of flavors here from the West, East, Midwest, and right here in the 206.
1. Jake One – The Truth (feat. Freeway and Brother Ali) 2. Atmosphere – Shoulda Known 3. Presto – Conquer Mentally (Large Pro Remix) (feat. Sadat X, O.C. and Large Professor) 4. EMC – Leak It Out 5. Madlib – Blindfold Test #10 (feat. J-Rocc) 6. The Mighty Underdogs – War Walk (feat. Chali 2na, Raashan Ahmad, Tash, and Zumbi) 7. DJ Muggs and Planet Asia – Pain Language 8. RZA as Bobby Digital – U Can’t Stop Me Now (feat. Inspectah Deck) 9. Factor – Lonely City (feat. Moka Only) 10. Common Market – Trouble Is 11. Grip Grand – Showtime (That’s Entertainment) 12. The Cool Kids – Black Mags 13. Champagne Champagne – Soda and Pop Rocks 14. Azeem – Latin Revenge 15. People Under The Stairs – Up Yo Spine 16. J-Live – The Upgrade (feat. Oddisee and Posdanous) 17. Lyrics Born – I Like It, I Love It 18. The High Decibels – Eye Of The Storm 19. Large Pro – Hot: Sizzling, Scorching, Torching, Blazing 20. Brooklyn Academy – Black Out (feat. Jean Grae) 21. GZA – Alphabets 22. The Gigantics – The Explanation (feat. Aesop Rock, Reason, Eligh) 23. Bash Bros. – Rock The Spot (Allstar Remix) (feat. Sean Price, Rakaa, Reef, Verbal Kent, Motion Man, Chali 2na and Big Pooh)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 124 - Aloha and Mahalo
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Midday Show host Cheryl Waters recorded this latest podcast just three days before leaving for a week's vacation. Two nights before, some dear friends asked if she wanted to go to Kauai with them. Of course, she said "Heck yeah!" and bought a plane ticket that night and was as excited by her spontaneity as she was about going to Hawaii. Before jetting away, though, she wanted to share a bundle of great music with you to enjoy. Aloha and Mahalo!
1. Stars - The Night Starts Here 2. She Keeps Bees - Gimmie 3. See Me River - Wake Up Are You Wasted 4. Blind Pilot - Go On, Say It 5. The Henry Clay People - Rock and Roll Has Lost Its Teeth 6. Constantines - Our Age 7. Au - rr vs. d 8. The Mae Shi - Run To Your Grave 9. Tobacco - Hairy Candy 10. Larytta - Bauch Amp 11. Ursula 1000 - Electrik Boogie (Fort Knox Five Remix) 12. Junior Senior - Can I Get Get Get 13. King Khan and the Shrines - Outta Harm's Way 14. DJ Bitman - Ejale!

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 123 - Fall Flu Shot Mix Tape
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Rachel gives you an anti-viral shot in the arm of new, unreleased, and up-and-coming artists in this Fall Flu Shot Mix Tape, which will keep you company during these cold almost-winter nights. Put on your favorite slippers, grab a cup of hot tea, take a few shots of your preferred cough syrup, sit back and enjoy the ride!
1. Leo Gebhardt IV - Unfaithful 2. Lady Dottie and the Diamonds - I Ain't Mad At Ya 3. Marni Stern - Transformer 4. David Byrne and Brian Eno - Strange Overtones 5. Nobunny - I Know I Know 6. Raggedy Anns - Prospector Joe 7. Golden Triangle - Prize Fighter 8. So Cow - So Cow vs. The Future 9. Mika Miko - Capricorinations 10. Mad Rad - My Product 11. Frustration - We Have Some 12. Black Orphan - Video Kids 13. Wavves - Wavves 14. Gang Gang Dance - Princes

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 122 - The Only Road I've Ever Been Down
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Morning Show host John Richards presents your soundtrack for walking the streets and getting where you need to go. Remember the video for "Bitter Sweet Symphony"? Same deal, but more bad ass.
1. Bound Stems - Taking Tips From the Gallery Gang 2. Bang Bang Eche - 4 To the Floor 3. One Day as a Lion - Wild International 4. Ten Kens - Bear Fight 5. Miles Benjamin Anthony Robinson - Woodfriend 6. All the Saints - Sheffield 7. Cold War Kids - I've Seen Enough 8. Man Plus - A Ghost Is A Ghost Is A Ghost (remix) 9. Passion Pit - I've Got Your Number 10. The King Left - The Storm In A Teacup 11. The Mugs - Could It Be 12. Rodriguez - Crucify Your Mind 13. Horse Feathers - Rude To Rile

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 121 - Art On My Sleeve
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
When DJ El Toro was in high school, he had a quote taped inside his composition book that read, "Sometimes we get bored. So we dye our hair." And boy did he: Orange, magenta, forest green. (That last one was an accident. Damn chlorinated pools.) This podcast celebrates the joys of an ever-evolving, polychromatic aesthetic, via a set of inspired, arty tunes - plus a couple of foot-stompers and booty-shakers. Colorful? Yes. Hair-raising? You be the judge.
1. The Week That Was - Learn To Learn 2. Simon Bookist - Carbon 3. Lake - Blue Ocean Blue 4. Mercury Rev - People Are So Unpredictable 5. The Dead Science - Throne (The Jump Off) 6. School of Seven Bells - Half-Asleep 7. Yo Majesty! - Booty Klap 8. Koushik - Be With 9. Ponytail - Late For School 10. Dungen - Det Tar Tid 11. Arthur Russell - Close My Eyes 12. O'Death - Mountain Shifts 13. Parenthetical Girls - Song for Ellie Greenwich 14. The Vivian Girls - All The Time

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 120 - Names Only a Mother Could Love
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Not only do you get some pretty awesome catchy songs, selected by DJ Shannon, but think about how excited you’ll get reciting the song “Brave Bulging Buoyant Clairvoyant” and saying the band “Bryan Scary and the Shredding Tears” to your friends. Even your mom will smile.
1. Wild Beasts - Brave Bulging Buoyant Clairvoyant 2. Bryan Scary and the Shredding Tears - The Imitation of the Sky 3. The XYZ Affair - Evening Life 4. The Black Ghosts - Repetition Kills Me 5. Chairlift - Bruises 6. Telepathe - Chrome's On It 7. Florence and the Machine - Kiss with a Fist 8. Hello Saferide - Anna 9. Last Shadow Puppets - Standing Next to Me (acoustic) 10. The Vanguard - The Antidote's Retreat 11. The Sugars - Black Friday

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 119 - Benevolent of the Dandy
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Odes to adolescence, Cracker Jack boxes, and drumming mannequins -- you'll find it all in Kevin Cole's mix of 16 awesome new songs, from the deep groove of Thievery Corporation to the pop-punk of All Girl Summer Fun Band!
1. The Moondoggies - Changing 2. Bound Stems - Happens To Us All Otherwise 3. Crooked Fingers - Your Control 4. Stars - 14 Forever 5. Mercury Rev - Butterfly's Wings 6. Starfucker - Holly 7. Populous with Short Stories - Man Overboard 8. Thievery Corporation - Radio Retaliation 9. Jake One - The Truth 10. Subswara - TKM 11. Ani DiFranco - Alla This 12. Steve Wynn - Manhattan Fault Line 13. Stuporhero - Cyclops 14. All Girl Summer Fun Band - Something New 15. Minisnap - Leave It To You 16. The Spinto Band - Summer Grof

Populous with Short Stories - Man Overboard 8. Thievery Corporation - Radio Retaliation 9. Jake One - The Truth 10. Subswara - TKM 11. Ani DiFranco - Alla This 12. Steve Wynn - Manhattan Fault Line 13. Stuporhero - Cyclops 14. All Girl Summer Fun Band - Something New 15. Minisnap - Leave It To You 16. The Spinto Band - Summer Grof

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 116 - Spotlight on Decibel Festival 2008
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex shines a spotlight on select artists performing at this year's 5th annual Decibel Festival, Seattle's premier electronic music event! Running from September 25th to September 28th, Decibel Festival will feature over 120 acts from 12 different countries, organized within 25 showcases across 11 different venues. Tune in to get a taste of this year's diverse and stacked roster, and check out www.dbfestival.com for more information!
01. Balún - A Surprise 02. Nalepa - Monday (The Glitch Mob Remix) 03. Jahcoozi - Gameboy 04. KiloWatts - Snakewinds 05. Lusine - Still Frame (Lusine Remix) 06. Jeremy Ellis - I Believe 07. Helios - The Obeisant Vine 08. Eluvium - Requiem on Frankfort Ave. 09. Tycho - The Daydream 10. The Sight Below - A Fractured Smile 11. The Bug - Insane (f. Warrior Queen) 12. Truckasauras - Ain't No Danbo (When He's Gone) 13. Barbara Morgenstern - The Operator 14. Dave Pezzner - Other Lover 15. Flying Lotus - Parisian Goldfish 16. Supermayer - The Art of Letting Go

item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Music That Matters, Vol. 115 - DJ Shani's Local Picks
DJ Shani presents her current favorite Seattle bands in her 3rd Music That Matters Podcast. Check it out to hear new or unreleased tracks from bands like Panda and Angel, Truckasauras, Past Lives, AFCGT, The Curious Mystery, and more!

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 112 - Meet Me at the Audioasis
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Hannah Levin has been hosting KEXP’s long-running local music show, Audioasis, for a little over a year and a half now, and one of the most enjoyable parts of her job is the thrill of our weekly in-studio performances. Every Saturday evening between 6 and 9 p.m., KEXP invites two local bands to stop by and play a few songs. We’ve been fortunate enough to capture some stellar performances, so Hannah figured it was high time to cull the archives and pull out some of her favorites.
1. Rocky Votolato - Tinfoil Hats (Live @ KEXP) 2. New Faces - Cracks (Live @ KEXP) 3. Champagne Champagne - Cover Girl (Live @ KEXP) 4. The Intelligence - Dating Cops (Live @ KEXP) 5. J. Tillman - Seven States Across (Live @ KEXP) 6. Team Gina - Stars (Live @ KEXP) 7. Schoolyard Heroes - Dude, Where’s My Skin? (Live @ KEXP) 8. Calvin Johnson - Pine Shaped Boy (Live @ KEXP) 9. The Duchess and the Duke - Mary (Live @ KEXP) 10. Past Lives - Strange Symmetry (Live @ KEXP)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 111 - KEXP Bumbershoot Music Lounge Podcast
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Kevin Cole presents highlights from KEXP's live broadcast from the Music Lounge during the 2007 Bumbershoot Music and Arts Festival. This year, on the secret stage in the heart of the festival grounds, we have another great lineup with bands like !!!, Sons and Daughters, Thao with the Get Down Stay Down, and the Old 97's. On this podcast, you'll hear some of those bands and a few others performing at Bumbershoot this year.
1. Fleet Foxes - Oliver James (live on KEXP) 2. Andrew Bird - Plasticities (live on KEXP) 3. Band of Horses - Ode To LRC (Live on KEXP) 4. The Walkmen - Postcards From Tiny Islands 5. The Weakerthans - Tournament of Hearts 6. Art Brut - Emily Kane (live on KEXP) 7. Iceage Cobra - Weapon of Mass Seduction (live on KEXP) 8. Sons and Daughters - Split Lips 9. The Gourds - I'm Troubled (live on KEXP) 10. Bert Jansch - Trouble In Mind (live on KEXP) 11. Thao with the Get Down Stay Down - Swimming Pools 12. Mocean Worker - Shake Ya Boogie (live on KEXP)

1. Matt Jorgensen +451 - Everything in Its Right Place 2. Byron Vannoy - Valid Alibi 3. Tiptons Sax Q'tet - Number Six 4. Pax Wallace - With Malice Toward None 5. Big Bad Groove Society - Duke's Jungle 6. Ben Thomas - Triskaidekaphobia 7. Bishop/Johnson/Mandyck/Teuber - Walk Spirit, Talk Spirit 8. Paul Rucker - History of an Apology 9. Mandyck/Marriott/Keplinger - Amiga 10. Stinkhorn - Tunguska 11. Richard Cole - A Shade of Joe 12. Matt Jorgensen - No Quarter 13. Larry Fuller - Groove Yard

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 108 - A Full Tank of Gas and Half a Pack of Cigarettes
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
John's got an hour worth of songs, a full tank of gas, half a pack of cigarettes, it's dark, he's wearing sunglasses -- get ready for your next installment of the Music That Matters podcast featuring the very best of the Morning Show.
1. Clinic - The Witch 2. Violens - Violent Sensation Descends 3. Styrofoam - After Sunset 4. Man Plus - A Ghost Is a Ghost Is a Ghost 5. El Ten Eleven - Every Direction Is North 6. Kunk - We're Not Who You think We Are 7. Ladytron - Ghosts 8. Kaiser Cartel - Oh No 9. Shawn Smith - Ring That Bell 10. Head Like a Kite - No Ordinary Caveman 11. Annuals - Sore 12. The Low Lows - Sparrows 13. The Blows - Two Minutes 14. Bad Dudes - Heterosaucer 15. Chicha Libre - Popcorn Andino

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 107 - Sonic Reducer Punkcast
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Welcome to the Music that Matters Punkcast. I'm Mr. West co-host of Sonic Reducer, KEXP's weekly punk show. I am joined by friend of the show DJ Jeremy and faithful intern Stephie. We are going to bring you the newest and best in punk, hardcore, and other weirdness, from here in Seattle and across the world. We'll do our best to let you know what we'll be playing, but if you're anything like me you want to check out the playlist before you listen.
1. Jay Reatard - All Wasted 2. Eddy Current Suppression Ring - We'll Be Turned On 3. Crash Normal - Heavy Listening 4. Lamborghiniz - BOOM!! Get them drawls off! 5. Juanita Y Los Feos - Tu Secta Es Guay 6. Mayyors - (Side A off debut 7") 7. The Wicked Awesomes! - Fighting the Wolf Spirit 8. Wizzard Sleeve - Alabama's Doomed 9. Fag Cop - Automatic Kansas 10. The Wax Museums - I eat Vomit 11. Live Fast Die - Pissing on the Mainframe 12. Walls - Tread On Me/Punch Out 13. Iron Lung - Politics of Science 14. Sex Vid - Exorcism 15. Genghis Tron - City on a Hill 16. Said Radio - Roses 17. Government Warning - Government Warning 18. 100 Flowers - Reject Yourself 19. Harpoon Guns - 15 20. Le Face - Salvador Dali 21. Frances Harold and the Holograms - Two Faggots, One Cunt
Thanks so much for listening to this special MTM podcast, The Sonic Reducer Edition. To listen to tons more punk check out our little show on 9-midnight every Saturday night where Brian Foss, Nick Turner and I, Mr. West, will bludgeon you with punk AND hardcore. Thanks so much to Jeremy and Stephie -- they have done as much if not more to put this podcast together; it wouldn't have been 1/3 as good without them. Thanks to Jim, Rachel, Reese and all the bands who could and could not be on the podcast.

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 106 - Bumbershoot Sneak Preview!
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Bumbershoot Music and Arts Festival takes places in Seattle on Labor Day weekend, Aug 30th - Sept 1st. Check out some of the bands playing, learn how you and a friend can win hotel, airfare and VIP passes, and have some fun along the way! Featuring music from !!!, Dan Deacon, Throw Me the Statue, Neko Case, Kinski, and more!
1. Superchunk - Misfits and Mistakes 2. !!! - All My Heroes Are Weirdos 3. Del Tha Funky Homosapien - Bubble Pop 4. Dan Deacon - Okie Dokie 5. Throw Me the Statue - Lolita 6. Nada Surf - See These Bones 7. New Faces - Impulse 8. Howlin Rain - Dancers at the End of Time 9. Neko Case - Needle Has Landed 10. PWRFL Power - Coffee Girl Song 11. Mark Pickerel and His Praying Hands - Cody's Dream 12. Star Anna - Restless Water (Live @ KEXP) 13. The Hands - I Don't Want to Turn You On 14. Kinski - Punching Goodbye Out Front 15. Black Eyes and Neckties - Broken Teeth

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 105 - Comedy Edition, Vol. 1
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
On KEXP's first Music That Matters Comedy Edition podcast, DJ Troy Nelson and KEXP blogger Corbett Cummins tag team a set of hardcore funny. Rock out with stand-up material from David Cross, Patton Oswalt and Jim Gaffigan and laugh your ass off with music from Brian Posehn, Hard 'N Phirm and the Asylum Street Spankers.
1. Eugene Mirman - Movie, Deep-Fried Stuffed Cheeseburger, What Kind of Animal?, Red Tide, Abortion 2. Todd Barry - Chipotle, Trader Joes 3. Michael Ian Black - Married With Children 4. Patton Oswalt - On Small Towns and Coolness 5. Steven Wright - Camera 6. David Cross - Women Please Rinse Off Your Vagina and Anus 7. Jim Gaffigan - Hoooot Pocket 8. Mike Birbiglia - The Guitar Guy at the Party 9. Cars Can Be Blue - Hey Hippie 10. Black Daisy - Bearing Down on Me 11. Brian Posehn - Metal by Numbers 12. “Awesome” - American Boyfriend 13. Hard ‘N Phirm - Moose Lodge 14. David Cope - Round House Kick 15. Name Asylum Street Spankers - The Scrotum Song

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 104 - Please Enjoy
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
The beat is correct on this summery mix of futurismo Brazilian breaks, Argentinean nectar, afro-beat inspired jazz, sharp drest hip-hop, and plenty of new Seattle sounds (good!). Please enjoy this set by Kevin Cole for your happy consideration.
1. The Cute Lepers - It's Summertime Baby 2. Telekinesis! - All of a Sudden 3. Jesse Sykes - In the Summertime 4. Fleet Foxes - White Winter Hymnal 5. Kassin+2 - Tranquilo 6. Cloud Cult - Ghost Inside Our House 7. NOMO - Three Shades 8. Natalia Clavier - Dormida 9. Mochipet - Sharp Drest 10. The Cool Kids - Bassment Party 11. James Pants - Crystal Lite

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 103 - What The Heck
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
DJ Sharlese hosts the latest in her series of podcasts focusing on NW artists. This time, she features bands scheduled to play What The Heck Fest 2008, a 3-day festival taking place in Anacortes, WA, on July 18-20.
1. Little Wings - Boom 2. Lake - Oh The Places 3. Love Tan - Nothing Belongs to You 4. Lucky Dragons - Wooden Cave Loop 5. Mirah and Spectratone International - Gestation of the Sacred Beetle (Live @ KEXP) 6. Karl Blau - Bird Song 7. The Gift Machine - Back to the Source 8. Dear Nora - Solo Wanderer 9. Calvin Johnson - Good and Crazy (Live @ KEXP) 10. Photosynthesis - Shadows and Sparks 11. Coconut Coolouts - (Please Don’t Break Me Out Of) Party Jail 12. The Moondoggies - Side of the Road 13. D+ - Double Crossed 14. The Blow - Come On Petunia 15. Mt. Eerie - A Sentimental Song 16. TacocaT - Leotard 17. Your Heart Breaks (ft. Kimya Dawson) - Torrey Pines

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 102 - The Better Things
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
DJ Shannon brings you music with sun, water, magic, teenagers, days, blooms, balloons and clocks. A springy summer mix. Relax, sit back and enjoy the better things in music.
1. South - Better Things 2. Chairlift - Evident Utensil 3. The LK - Stop Being Perfect 4. Magic Wands - Teenage Love 5. People of Water - Pink Conch 6. Sunny Day Sets Fire - Teenagers Talking 7. Peggy Sue and The Pirates - Television 8. We Were Promised Jetpacks - Moving Clocks Run Slow 9. Foals - Balloons 10. The Voom Blooms - Lucille 11. Matt Costa - Mr. Pitiful 12. Violens - Already Over 13. Days - Downhill 14. The Crimea - The 48A Waiting Steps 15. Pela - Good Foot on a Bad Doorstep

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 101 - DJ Shani's Thundercast
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Join DJ Shani on her second KEXP podcast where she plays her favorite tunes of the past few months from bands that she's totally excited about and hopes you will be too. At the end, we think you'll all agree that there's really nothing better than a box of records, especially when it's raining all the time outside (yeah, Seattle, we're talking to you... it's JUNE, didn't you know?!)
1. Guinea Worms - Box Of Records 2. Bonnie Prince Billy - Lie Down In The Light 3. The Black Swans - Shake 4. Mattress - Mirror 5. The Child Readers - Young Worlds - Try To Hear! 6. Catatonic Youth - Control My Gun 7. Indian Jewelry - Temporary Famine Ship 8. Cheveu - Dog 9. Experimental Aircraft - Upper East Side 10. Nothing People - In The City 11. Blank Dogs - Crystal Ladies 12. Lucky Dragons - Givers 13. Nat Baldwin - Lake Erie 14. Corespondents - In The Face Of Those Who Want Us Hurt

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 100 - One Hundred Years of Podcasting
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
Back in 1908, KEXP had a vision... it was a new century, the first passenger flight was flown, explorers were just reaching the North Pole, and William Howard Taft became the twenty-seventh President of the United States, and there was KEXP podcasting... what? it's "Volume" 100 and not "year" 100? -- oh, well, only 98 more years to go!
1. Power Douglas - Pangea 2. A Place to Bury Strangers - Missing You 3. No Age - Eraser 4. The Bell - On and On 5. Factory Floor - Bi-Polar 6. Sunset - Man's Heart Complaint 7. We Were Promised Jetpacks - Quiet Little Voices 8. Ting Tings - Great DJ 9. Lykke Li - Little Bit 10. Carter Tanton (of Tulsa) - Mass (recorded LIVE on KEXP) 11. The Real Tuesday Weld - Love at the Death Hotel (from Esopus #10) 12. Palodine - Woman of Cain 13. Nick Cave - Dig, Lazarus, Dig!

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 99 - Slipping Under the Radar
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Alex, KEXP's newest and youngest DJ, takes you on an eclectic ride around the world and under the radar, exposing independent artists currently roaming the underground. Tune in and indulge in a mix that's guaranteed to add a strut to your step and make your brain itch a little.
1. Metaform - Urban Velvet 2. Ruckus Roboticus - Here We Go 3. Louis La Roché - On the Floor 4. Tobias Fröberg - Slipping Under the Radar 5. diskJokke - Staying In 6. Spoon - Don't You Evah (Matthew Dear Mix) 7. Quiet Village - Circus of Horror 8. Blue Sky Black Death - A Private Death 9. Dosh - Hit and Pearle 10. Eliot Lipp - See What It's About 11. Karl Blau - Lake King's Daughter 12. Subtle - Exiting Arm 13. Artemis Jackson - Asps and Adders 14. The Wet Secrets - Secret March 15. Rafter - Love Time Now Please 16. item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 98 - It's-Almost-Summer-So-Sit-Tight Mixtape!
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Hey! DJ Rachel just made you your very own Spring mixtape! She knows how excited you are for summer and she put together some songs to get you though the rainy, flower-blooming, allergy-filled days of Spring. Summer's almost here, I swear. Sit tight and enjoy some rarities, previously unreleased tracks, demos, covers, noise, and more!
1. Thomas Function - Snake on the Grass 2. Man Party - Dance Monkey 3. Catatonic Youth - I've Had It 4. The Dutchess and the Duke - Reservoir Park (7" version) 5. Carrots - Beverly 6. Bow + Arrow - We Bricklayers 7. J. Tillman - Steel on Steel 8. Katharine Hepburn's Voice - Jerry Death 9. The Kills - U.R.A. Fever 10. Eddie Current Supression Ring - Get Up Morning 11. T.V. Cohran - Roadbirds 12. Your Heart Breaks - God Speed John Glen (Live @ KEXP) 13. Thee Oh Sees - The Coconut 14. Strap Straps - Kill for Jesus 15. Fuck Buttons - Bright Tomorrow 16. Pyramids - Fuzzy Grave 17. Liars - Army of Me (courtesy of Stereogum)

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 97 - All Things Sasquatch!
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
You say "Sass-quatch," I say "Sauce-squatch" -- whatever your preference, the three-day festival is sure to rock your socks off with a stellar assortment of bands including Ghostland Observatory, Beirut, Fleet Foxes, Blue Scholars, and so much more. Download this podcast, hosted by Cheryl Waters, for the lowdown on all things Sasquatch and get one hell of a mixtape to listen to as you make the trek out to the Gorge.
1. Flight of the Conchords - Business Time 2. Dead Confederate - The Rat 3. Yeasayer - Sunrise 4. Ghostland Observatory - Heavy Heart 5. Pela - Tenement Teeth 6. White Rabbits - Kid On My Shoulders 7. Fleet Foxes - White Winter Hymnal (LIVE on KEXP) 8. Grand Archives - Torn Blue Foam Couch 9. Beirut - A Sunday Smile 10. Joshua Morrison - Home 11. Sera Cahoone - Only As The Day Is Long 12. Okkervil River - Our Life Is Not a Movie Or Maybe 13. Throw Me The Statue - About To Walk 14. Cold War Kids - Tell Me In the Morning 15. Thao With the Get Down Stay Down - Bag of Hammers 16. Rogue Wave - Lake Michigan 17. Say Hi - Northwestern Girls 18. The Morning Benders - Waiting for a War 19. The Blakes - Lintwalk 20. Blue Scholars - Joe Metro 21. Jamie Lidell - Hurricane

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 96 - Don't Know Much About History
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 96
item.description:
Rock out and learn stuff at the same time. Kevin Cole presents songs about an early 20th century farmer's rebellion, the Swiss-Algerian explorer and writer Isabelle Eberhardt, and the skin disease Alopecia. Plus, someone still loves Boris Yeltsin. Get schooled by this Music That Matters podcast.
1. The Little Ones - Forgive Yourself 2. Frightened Rabbit - I Feel Better 3. DJ Dolores - Danger Global Warming 4. Testbild! - Labyrinthine 5. Metaform - PCH 6. Why? - Fatalist Palmistry 7. Nortec Collective - Mama Loves Nortec 8. Common Market - Black Patch War 9. You Me and Iowa - Tommy Hall 10. Someone Still Loves You, Boris Yeltsin - Boring Fountain 11. Destroyer - Foam Hands

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 95 - Freaks and Geeks
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
This one is for all the nerds, misfits, introverts, and folks who simply march to the beat of their own drummer. For MTM 95, DJ El Toro parsed through recent music by some of his favorite oddballs, plus some newer acts that skew left-of-center. Dig into this mix of avant garde disco, orchestral pop, smart aleck hip-hop, and distinctive singing, and let your freak and/or geek flag fly proudly.
1. Hercules & Love Affair – Hercules Theme 2. Final Fantasy – Hey Dad 3. LD & The New Criticism – What You Will 4. Cadence Weapon – New Face of Fashion 5. Shy Child – Drop The Phone 6. Thalia Zedek Band – circa the end 7. Head Like A Kite – Before We Go To Bed 8. M83 – Graveyard Girl 9. Baby Dee – Fresh Out of Candles 10. James Pants – We're Through 11. PWRFL POWER – It's Okay 12. Bon Iver – For Emma 13. Russian Circles – Harper Lewis

item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 94 - Cats of All Kinds

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 93 - Bubblin' In The Cut
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
For this installment of KEXP’s Music That Matters podcast series, DJ Chilly collects some of his recent favorites in hip-hop, dub, drum and bass, and other beats. It's delivered in a full-on mixtape style for repeated neck crackability
1. Boreta - Bubblin' In The Cut 2. Big Quarters - Sign Of The Time 3. Living Legends - The Gathering 4. Ghislain Poirier - No More Blood (feat. Face-T) 5. Mnolo - Guerra Futbol 6. The Lions - Cumbia Del Leon 7. One Be Lo - Rebirth 8. Kublakai - All Else Fails 9. Akrobatik - Put Ya Stamp On It (feat. Talib Kweli) 10. Othello - Rot 11. Dub Fanatic - Steak And Fries 12. Rustie - Jagz The Smack 13. DJ Mayonnaise - Quiet On The Set 14. Boys Noize - Let’s Buy Happiness (Proxy Remix) 15. DJ Kentaro - Trust 16. PG-13 And Wake - Lyrical Soda Paper 17. item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 92 - Music That's Been Greatly Lately
item.itunes:author: various artists
item.description:
DJ Troy Nelson takes you through another podcast, this time spinning mostly brand new music that he is currently excited about. There's nothing like hearing brand new music, especially from brand new artists that take you by complete surprise! From up-and-comers to unknowns waiting to be discovered to a Bowie/Queen cover that doesn't suck -- it's all here in this Music That Matters podcast.
1. Tea Cozies - Pretty Pages 2. The Jet Age - Maybe Love's a Transmission 3. Evangelicals - Skeleton Man 4. Xiu Xiu - Under Pressure (feat. Michael Gira) 5. The Epochs - Opposite Sides 6. Bronze Fawn - Lumber 7. Grynch - The Youngest in Charge 8. Glass Candy - Lovin' Machine 9. The Ettes - You Can't Do That to Me 10. Lumerians - Orgon Grinder

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 91 - It Is Quite Possible (After All)
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
We're not really sure what this podcast is about. It is quite possible that this is more than just a random collection of really new songs thrown together by Kevin Cole... or maybe not. Either way, these songs are amazing. It is music that matters... after all.
1. New Faces - My Alarm 2. Born Ruffians - Hummingbird 3. The Ruby Suns - Tane Mahuta 4. The Lions - Jungle Struttin' 5. Thao with the Get Down Stay Down - Beat (Health, Life, Fire) 6. She and Him - Why Do You Let Me Stay Here? 7. Bubblegum Lemonade - Ten Years Younger 8. Manhattan Love Suicides - Heat and Panic 9. Joseph Arthur - Morning Cup 10. Headlights - Get Your Head Around It 11. Devotchka - Transliterator

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 89 - Happy Hour: Live In The Roadhouse
item.itunes:author: Music That Matters, Vol. 89
item.description:
Though often described as a dusty dive, the Roadhouse actually has a state-of-the-art performance studio in the back room (usually the spot for post-show poker games) where over the years, many guests have recorded live in-studio performances. This podcast collects some of the best sessions, including live performances from Greg's special "Origins Of The American Traditional Song" the "Woody Guthrie and The Columbia River Project" show. You'll also hear live performances from Eilen Jewell, Jesse Sykes, The Crooked Jades, and American music icons like Billy Joe Shaver, Doug Kershaw, and Charlie Musselwhite. Drink up!
1. Eilen Jewell - Rich Man's World (12/5/07) 2. Crooked Jades - Old Cow Died (10/4/06) 3. Doug Kershaw - Louisiana Man (1/16/08) 4. Shane Tutmarc - Hard Traveling (9/26/07) 5. Barton Carroll - John Henry (11/21/07) 6. Levi Fuller - Frankie and Johnny (11/21/07) 7. Sam Watts - In the Pines (11/21/07) 8. Cephas and Wiggins - Seattle Rainy Day Blues (8/9/06) 9. Charlie Musselwhite - Christo Redemptor (7/19/06) 10. Billy Joe Shaver - To Be Loved By A Woman (10/3/07) 11. Jesse Sykes - Fuckery (4/17/02)

This podcast collects some of the best sessions, including live performances from Greg's special "Origins Of The American Traditional Song" the "Woody Guthrie and The Columbia River Project" show. You'll also hear live performances from Eilen Jewell, Jesse Sykes, The Crooked Jades, and American music icons like Billy Joe Shaver, Doug Kershaw, and Charlie Musselwhite. Drink up!
1. Eilen Jewell - Rich Man's World (12/5/07) 2. Crooked Jades - Old Cow Died (10/4/06) 3. Doug Kershaw - Louisiana Man (1/16/08) 4. Shane Tutmarc - Hard Traveling (9/26/07) 5. Barton Carroll - John Henry (11/21/07) 6. Levi Fuller - Frankie and Johnny (11/21/07) 7. Sam Watts - In the Pines (11/21/07) 8. Cephas and Wiggins - Seattle Rainy Day Blues (8/9/06) 9. Charlie Musselwhite - Christo Redemptor (7/19/06) 10. Billy Joe Shaver - To Be Loved By A Woman (10/3/07) 11. Jesse Sykes - Fuckery (4/17/02)
item.itunes:summary:
Though often described as a dusty dive, the Roadhouse actually has a state-of-the-art performance studio in the back room (usually the spot for post-show poker games) where over the years, many guests have recorded live in-studio performances. This podcast collects some of the best sessions, including live performances from Greg's special "Origins Of The American Traditional Song" the "Woody Guthrie and The Columbia River Project" show. You'll also hear live performances from Eilen Jewell, Jesse Sykes, The Crooked Jades, and American music icons like Billy Joe Shaver, Doug Kershaw, and Charlie Musselwhite. Drink up!
1. Eilen Jewell - Rich Man's World (12/5/07) 2. Crooked Jades - Old Cow Died (10/4/06) 3. Doug Kershaw - Louisiana Man (1/16/08) 4. Shane Tutmarc - Hard Traveling (9/26/07) 5. Barton Carroll - John Henry (11/21/07) 6. Levi Fuller - Frankie and Johnny (11/21/07) 7. Sam Watts - In the Pines (11/21/07) 8. Cephas and Wiggins - Seattle Rainy Day Blues (8/9/06) 9. Charlie Musselwhite - Christo Redemptor (7/19/06) 10. Billy Joe Shaver - To Be Loved By A Woman (10/3/07) 11. Jesse Sykes - Fuckery (4/17/02)

item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
DJ Sharlese hosts the third in a series of podcasts that profile bands from specific areas around the Northwest. This Music That Matters podcast features bands from the current scene in Bellingham, WA.

Go Slowpoke - Kiss Now, Drunk Later 5. I Love You Avalanche - Pleiades 6. Asthmaboy - EraseHer 7. Jonathan McIntyre - The Path Home Rarely Changes 8. Yogoman Burning Band - Chaka Chaka 9. item.description:
John in the Morning brings you the best of the Morning Show -- including Bob Mould, The Helio Sequence, and Chris Walla -- and explains what to do when a Jellyfish stings you or you get hit with a bag of hammers.

item.description:
Lisa Wood, one of the hosts of KEXP's Audioasis, moved to Portland a year ago and is discovering a new batch of Northwest bands. She brings you this Music That Matters podcast, dedicated to Portland bands that she thinks you need to hear.

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 77 - Chilly's Hip-Hop Favorites 2007
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
DJ Chilly features some of his favorite hip-hop tracks from the year 2007. This podcast/mixtape) is packed with 21 songs from stars like Pharoahe Monch and RZA to new independent artists like Brother Reade and Dyme Def. There’s something for everyone with lots of local representation! This year give the gift of hip-hop.
1. Brother Ali - Lookin' At Me Sideways 2. Dyme Def - Clap Clap 3. Copperpot - Art Of Rap feat. Masta Ace and Edo G 4. Pharoahe Monch - Body Baby 5. Cancer Rising - Evryday Bidness 6. Galactic - From The Corner To The Block feat. Juvenile and Soul Rebels Brass Band 7. Wax Tailor – Positively Inclined feat. M. Quaisse and A.S.M. 8. Omni – Bang The Drum 9. Brother Reade – Everywhere I Go 10. Marco Polo – Rollin' feat. Sadat X, Ju Ju and AG 11. Zeph and Azeem – Everything's Different 12. El-P – Up All Night 13. Shape Of Broad Minds – Let's Go feat. MF Doom 14. edIT – Arsty Remix feat. Grouch 15. Luckyiam – Rap, Rap, Rap 16. Grayskul – Missing feat. Andrea Zollo 17. RZA – Cameo Afro feat. Big Daddy Kane, GZA and Suga Bang 18. Blue Scholars – Joe Metro 19. Aesop Rock – Citronella 20. Livesavas – The Warning 21. Gabriel Teodros – East Afrika

item.itunes:summary:
DJ Chilly features some of his favorite hip-hop tracks from the year 2007. This podcast/mixtape) is packed with 21 songs from stars like Pharoahe Monch and RZA to new independent artists like Brother Reade and Dyme Def. There’s something for everyone with lots of local representation! This year give the gift of hip-hop.

item.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 76 - I Had a Dream I Died
item.itunes:author: Various Artists
item.description:
Midday Show host Cheryl Waters shares some of her favorite music of the past few months, along with songs recorded live recently for KEXP. Here, you'll find a frosty mix from bands residing primarily above the 40th parallel.
1. Le Loup - I Had a Dream I Died (LIVE on KEXP in NYC) 2. Fleet Foxes - White Winter Hymnal (LIVE on KEXP from Bumbershoot) 3. Grizzly Bear - Little Brother (Electric) 4. Yeasayer - No Need to Worry (LIVE on KEXP in NYC) 5. We All Have Hooks For Hands - The Man Trying to Outfox Us All 6. Shooting Spires - Alive and Well 7. Siberian - Paper Birds 8. Montag - Safe in Sound 9. The Weakerthans - Tournament of Hearts 10. Tulsa - Shaker 11. Junius - Hiding Knives 12. Editors - Weight of the World 13. edIT - Battling Go-Go Yubari in Downtown LA 14. Blue Scholars - 50K Deep
